story:
Our Story

Epic started out as a little website called 'Boner Party', a light hearted sex humor site that got a lot of attention and amassed a pretty solid readership. I got tired of the format, and decided to turn it into something better - a legitimate magazine with original articles, pictorials and interviews solely on the internet. Not a single serving web presence of a magazine, like so many others, and not just a blog, but one focuses exclusively on original material.


The Impact

As a freelance writer and editor I've often supplied my work to established blogs for exposure and not for pay. This is the case for many who are freelancers and is highlighted by any random search of the Writing/Editing jobs on Craigslist: get paid in "exposure". As anyone who's ever realized that "exposure" doesn't pay the bills can tell you, "exposure" on a website and a dollar fifty will get you a cup of coffee and little more. I should know. I spent months living on friends couches wondering why established companies were paying on a scale due to pageviews or more often than not, nothing at all.


What We Need & What You Get

So, I took that time on couches to figure it out. And it's simple: Pay the artists. 


What I plan to do is have people submit original work and pay them to feature it on the site. The writer or photographer would get their work featured on the site and a small amount of cash - plain and simple. No catch. They'd get to keep the rights to their work. All I'd ask in return is that they acknowledge in future usage that their work appeared on Epic first. The articles and photographs that run would follow the editorial direction of myself and a few others (a photo editor and a copy editor) who would help give birth to this new venture. Should you so kindly invest in us you wouldn't be buying us dinner: the only money we'd make would be on advertisements and a future iPad app of the magazine showcasing the highlights of the original online magazine. The money that you donate to us would be used to pay the writer or photographer.


I plan to feature one submitted original writing piece a day. This could mean a short story, profile, or opinion piece of a couple thousand words to a few original paragraphs. I plan to pay the contributor $20 for their work, serializing longer pieces (one half on Monday, the final half the next Monday, etc) if necessary in order to pay them more. 


4 x $20 = $80

$80 x 4 (weeks a month) = $320 a month

$320 x 12 (months in a year) = $3,840 a year


Once a week, Epic plans to feature the work of a photographer, who would submit a small cache of photographs which would be featured on the site. I plan to occasionally showcase nudity in the weekly photographic feature as I believe that nudity is not a thing to be afraid of, some may have an issue with this and I'd like to state loud and clear that we in no way shall be displaying photography that is distasteful or derogatory. Think more Ryan McGinley, Jim Herrington, or Noah Kalina. At it's most colorful, the Epic pictorials would resemble early Playboy. We simply believe that nudity is nothing to be afraid of and that the human body (of both women and men) is a beautiful thing. We plan to pay both the photographer and the model the same amount of money, separately, and via Paypal. This way it is fair to the model and the photographer.


$100 (for the photographer) + $100 (for the model)
4 (weeks in a month) x $200 = $800 a month
$800 x 12 (months in a year) = $9,600 a year

________________

This brings our grand total up to $13,400 a year to run Epic and to pay our contributors fairly.


Even though the current incantation of Epic is new, we have over 7,000 subscribers on Tumblr. We also have a podcast that reaches over 100,000 people a month ('This American Wife', which features guests from MSTK3000 to Gwar to Justine Bateman, etc) which drives in a lot of traffic to the website. This way, you can be assured that your donation will reach a very sizable and diverse audience.

story:
My Story

One of my goals on my bucket list over the past few years, is to volunteer abroad in Peru and work with children. Reaching outside of my immediate community is not new to me. And neither is my love for working with kids.  I have volunteered in the past with children in the Dominican Republic, built a home in Sydell Louisiana after Hurricane Katrina, and helped to rebuild mobile homes on the Lakota Indian Reservation in South Dakota.  I've been active with many charities domestically that benefit children including the Make A Wish Foundation. I also have the desire to initiate a yearly volunteer trip at my alma mater (for a later date).  In the Dominican Republic, I was blessed to have spent time with so many wonderful children, teaching them in the classroom, reading books together and playing games together outside.  I walked away from the experience taking away more from it than I thought I would.  My main takeaway was that caring ways, friendship and love mean so much to these children even more so than the donations that we brought with us on the trip.  Kindness and reaching out to others goes a long way in life.

 

Why Peru? Peru like many countries face a high level of poverty.  Many children have a lack of education and health care.  I've been blessed to be able to fund my own education through loans and obtain degrees, but that happened because my life was filled with wonderful mentors who encouraged me, including family, teachers, people at my church, and coaches.  I want to play an important though small part in loving, encouraging and supporting these children.   

 

So why now? I've always wanted to do this.  I am blessed to be graduating from Notre Dame this year and starting an amazing job in August.  I'll be staying with my family for the summer and this is an ideal time to volunteer.  I am unbelievably excited to say the least.

 

When am I going? My trip is from June 3rd to the 16th. 

 

I plan to maintain a blog while I am in Peru and upload lots of photos.


The Impact

I will be volunteering through Globalteer, a UK charity.  The Peru Children's Project is based in Cusco and includes working with orphans, teaching English, playing sports, reading and other fun activities. In addition, I will be doing manual work to improve the project facilities. 


What Do I Need

I have a hard time asking people for money.  However, living off loans for the past year and not starting work until August this year, makes for a tight budget.  My ideal goal is to fundraise the cost of the required "donation" that I am paying to Globalteer and to then donate the rest of the money I raise to this program for the benefit of the children and the facility.  I am paying for my own flight separately as well as food and miscellaneous expenses.  The donation that I will be paying to Globalteer is $920 and includes the following (project donation, airport pickup, accomodation, orientation, and in country support).  HOWEVER, if I don't make my goal of $1500, I will split whatever money I raise between my required donation and additional donation that I would like to make to the program.  I am asking people to consider donating to my cause and my dream of volunteering in Peru.  Every little bit helps.  THANK YOU!

story:
*NOTE: I made my goal on here lower than my goal stated to account for people who will send in checks. Therefore, we can go over my "goal" listed here because I still do need a total of $2,850. Also, extra money raised still goes towards rescuing children.

 

I have been asked (by people and by God) to go to Thailand with Destiny Rescue. I'm extremely excited about this opportunity, but know that I can't do it without your help. The video above explains some of what has been my thought process through all of this and more specifics on what is and will be happening in Thailand.

By contributing, you have the opportunity to change my life and the life of these girls in Thailand, so I ask that you will please consider partnering with me for my trip!

I also ask that you will support me and the team in prayer and feel free to share this cause with others you think would be interested!

Thank you so much for taking time to read and watch!

story:
*SHE RESCUE HOME: Shape Her Earth, Shape Her Eternity*

Leigh Ramsey, Senior Pastor of CitiPoint Church, started She Rescue Home after a trip to Cambodia in 2006, where she was approached by a girl begging for help because her 10 year old friend was just sold by her mother and father to two men. Inspired by these events, she created She Rescue Home: a safe, secure home, located in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, for young girls, ages 5-15, who are at risk or have been rescued from being trafficked. “There are complex issues that contribute to a girl being vulnerable to trafficking. Factors such as poverty, abuse, trickery or deception and unemployment or addiction in the family unit.” Each girl at SHE home is given counseling, medical attention, educational/vocational training, food, shelter, and clothing. Eventually, when the rehabilitation process is complete, the girls are re-integrated back into their family and Khmer society. SHE homes also work in partnership with local and international agencies in Cambodia to give the girls, their families and their communities opportunities to change their lives.


*WHAT'S MY PART?*

On January 14th, I will begin volunteering at the She Rescue Home in Phnom Penh, Cambodia for 6 months. I will be responsible for a wide variety of tasks in order to help out in any way I can. In addition to leading daily devotions and English lessons with both the staff and girls of the SHE home, I will be doing anything from administrative work and cleaning, to biking with the girls and helping them with homework. I am also looking forward to being able to apply my love for arts, sewing and design through doing arts and crafts with the girls and teaching them to sew (a valuable skill for a young Khmer girl to have in order to find work).

A year ago if someone told me that I’d be hopping on a plane to Cambodia to volunteer for 6 months, I’d have thought they were crazy. But now, I have never been more sure about a decision in my life. These young women have completely inpired and altered my perspective, and I haven’t even met them yet. I am honored to be a part of God’s work in their lives, and I’m anxious to see how they’re going to change mine.

Now, in order for me to be able to embark on this journey, there is alot that needs to be prepared first: physically, mentally, AND spiritually.  One thing in particular that I need is to raise approximately $5,500. This money would cover everything from my plane ticket and visa, to housing and other living expenses.
 
*HOW CAN YOU HELP?"
 
DONATIONS: First and foremost, I do need help financially. In order to meet my goal of $5,500, any donation, big or small, would be greatly appreciated.  
 
MAKE A PURCHASE: I have also prepared a small catalog of 7 handmade items that I'm personally making and selling to raise funds.  100% of the profits will go directly to funding my trip to Cambodia. Please see my facebook page to view the catalog:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Support-My-Mission-in-Cambodia/422610724467841?ref=hl
 
PRAYER: More than anything, the greatest help you can give would be your prayers.  This 6 month journey is completely outside of my comfort zone and expertise, and more than ever I am trusting that God will be guiding my steps through it all. So of course, you're prayers are so valuable and important to my mission.

For more information about my mission please contact me. I’d love to hear from you and share more of my story:

Christina Mendez:
551-427-7155
Christina.mendez189@gmail.com

For more information about She Rescue Home:

WEBSITE: http://sherescuehome.org/
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/sherescuehome

story:
Has climbing changed your life? Share the gift of climbing with an at-risk kid from the slums of Brazil and receive cool Christmas gifts from BEYONDgear.

The favelas (slums) of Rio de Janeiro are built within a Mecca of world class climbing. Youth in these underprivileged communities are faced with an array of difficulties and negative influences like drugs, violence and gang life. Climbing can offer these youth a positive alternative to their daily struggles and the construction of a modern climbing wall will provide them with this opportunity.

Approximately 5,000 murders are reported per year in Rio de Janeiro's favelas. Climbing is not the end all solution but it can certainly help.

 

How it works:

BEYONDgear is donating ALL PROCEEDS to the construction of a modern climbing wall for the CEU Urban Climbing School right there in the Rocinha "Favela" of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Join our movement to use adventure for good and receive cool BEYONDgear products that allow you to share your passion for adventure with at-risk youth who would never have that opportunity otherwise. 

 

The Perks

 



 
We also offer advanced packages including a framed photo of Rio's epic scenery, a tour of the CEU Urban Climbing School and Wall with a guided climb of Sugarloaf Peak in Rio, or the ultimate guided dream climb of Half Dome.

Our Story - A letter from Asa Firestone, Co-Founder of BEYONDgear and the CEU Urban Climbing School

In 2003, while living in Brazil, I traveled to Rio de Janeiro to climb on the wild granite peaks that erupt right out of the city. On the slopes of these cliffs, massive favelas (slums) have spawned from decades of Brazilian social inequalities. While visiting Rio, I was inspired to climb the wild ‘Two Brothers’ peak that soars 1,000 feet above the famous Ipanema Beach. However, I was told it was too dangerous due to heavily armed drug militias that made their headquarters in the nearby favelas. I was frustrated that a peak could not be climbed because of crime. I decided to do my part to change that by sharing my positive experiences of climbing with the favela community. By providing outdoor education and enabling access to the climbing resources just above the favelas, the power of adventure can be harnessed to change lives.

The Two Brothers Peak as seen from Ipanema Beach in Rio. The Vidigal Favela is seen to the left of the peaks and the massive Rocinha Favela is just behind the peaks.

In 2010, I teamed up with Andrew Lenz, a brilliant local climbing guide and change maker, to form the CEU Urban Climbing School in the Rocinha Favela. Rocinha is one of the largest slums in Brazil and located just below the Two Brothers Peak. CEU is a not for profit organization that utilizes the local rock climbing resources to help at-risk youth in Rio's favelas. CEU recently obtained permission from the Brazilian Bureau of Sports (SUDERJ) to build a professional climbing wall in the government managed Rocinha sports complex.

Climbing Sugarloaf Peak with the CEU Urban Climbing School

In order to help fund this project, we created BEYONDgear, a social enterprise that funds adventure sports programs to help at-risk youth. By creating a brand of lifestyle adventure gear that allows adventure enthusiasts to share their positive experiences in the outdoors with kids who would never have that opportunity otherwise, we can generate an entire movement to use adventure for good. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $50,000 to build a state of the art climbing wall in a government run sports complex in the Rocinha Favela (slum) of Rio de Janeiro. This climbing wall will facilitate replacing the bad risks of drugs and violence so prevalent in these communities with the positive risks of adventure. If we raise more money, we will continue to support the CEU Urban Climbing School in Rio to use rock climbing to help kids from the favelas. See below for a mock up of the climbing wall project:

Together, we can build the first climbing wall EVER to be constructed within a marginalized community.

What are we going to do with the money?

All proceeds raised by this campaign will go towards building a climbing wall for at-risk youth in the Favelas of Rio de Janiero, Brazil. With the sale of just 2,000 BEYONDgear bracelets, necklaces, hats and tees, we will have the appropriate funds to see this project through. Additional proceeds will go to the CEU Urban Climbing School to fund climbing education for the same at-risk youth.

Most of the money collected in this campaign will go directly to the project. Manufacturing and distribution costs associated with BEYONDgear products that are purchased through Indiegogo, as well as minor administrative fees will be deducted from the total collected. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for joining the BEYONDgear Movement to use adventure for good, you can continue to help by:

  1. Wearing BEYONDgear and telling the world
  2. Sharing our campaign on Facebook: Please like and share both the CEU facebook page and the BEYONDgear facebook page:
    • http://www.facebook.com/adventureforgood
    • http://www.facebook.com/escola.ceu
  3. Join our newsletter:  http://eepurl.com/ry6kX
  4. Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/beyondgear
    • Retweet our progress tweets every Wednesday at 2pm PST

Finally, indiegogo has told us to remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it. Join us to use adventure for good!!! 

FAQ

If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?

Just email us – info@gobeyondgear.com

What is a Stopper and why are many of our items designed around it?

A Stopper or Nut is a piece of climbing gear that protects climbers from falls. It is a tapered piece of metal that a climber lodges into a crack so it gets stuck and then connects his/her rope to it. We believe the stopper is an excellent symbol for our brand’s mission, to use adventure for good.

When will my perks be delivered?

Depends on the item but most will ship on 12:20:2012. OUR CHALK BAGS WILL NOT ARRIVE UNTIL AFTER CHRISTMAS! Please contact us if you have any questions.

What are our products made out of?

The Stopper Necklace / Bracelet is made out of pewter. The Stopper Earrings are silver plated with a surgical steel post to avoid skin allergies. The Chalk bags are partially made from recycled tents. The flexfit hats are made with 59% bamboo fiber and the rest cotton and spandex. The Tees are made from recycled plastic bottles by Playbackclothing.com and are surprisingly soft and comfortable.

Are BEYONDgear products available in retail stores?

Not yet, but soon! BEYONDgear will be in retail stores in 2013. 

Where are the products manufactured?

All of our BEYONDcharms jewelry is manufactured in Boulder, CO. Our chalk bags are made by local artisans in Peru. The hats are currently made in Vietnam. The Tees are made here in the good old USA.

Is there a charge for International Shipping?

Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally. It costs $15 per item to ship to international addresses.  If you buy a 2-item dual set it costs $25. For a Full-Set it is $40. For a Framed Photo Package it costs an extra $75 (a framed photo is a big item to ship internationally). Please include this in the checkout price.  If you forget, we'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize those details.

If you have any specific questions about your location, please email us at: info@gobeyondgear.com.

The Two Brothers Peak as seen from Ipanema Beach in Rio. The Vidigal Favela is seen to the left of the peaks and the massive Rocinha Favela is just behind the peaks.

In 2010, I teamed up with Andrew Lenz, a brilliant local climbing guide and change maker, to form the CEU Urban Climbing School in the Rocinha Favela. Rocinha is one of the largest slums in Brazil and located just below the Two Brothers Peak. CEU is a not for profit organization that utilizes the local rock climbing resources to help at-risk youth in Rio's favelas. CEU recently obtained permission from the Brazilian Bureau of Sports (SUDERJ) to build a professional climbing wall in the government managed Rocinha sports complex.


Climbing Sugarloaf Peak with the CEU Urban Climbing School

In order to help fund this project, we created BEYONDgear, a social enterprise that funds adventure sports programs to help at-risk youth. By creating a brand of lifestyle adventure gear that allows adventure enthusiasts to share their positive experiences in the outdoors with kids who would never have that opportunity otherwise, we can generate an entire movement to use adventure for good. 




What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $50,000 to build a state of the art climbing wall in a government run sports complex in the Rocinha Favela (slum) of Rio de Janeiro. This climbing wall will facilitate replacing the bad risks of drugs and violence so prevalent in these communities with the positive risks of adventure. If we raise more money, we will continue to support the CEU Urban Climbing School in Rio to use rock climbing to help kids from the favelas. See below for a mock up of the climbing wall project:

Together, we can build the first climbing wall EVER to be constructed within a marginalized community.



What are we going to do with the money?
All proceeds raised by this campaign will go towards building a climbing wall for at-risk youth in the Favelas of Rio de Janiero, Brazil. With the sale of just 2,000 BEYONDgear bracelets, necklaces, hats and tees, we will have the appropriate funds to see this project through. Additional proceeds will go to the CEU Urban Climbing School to fund climbing education for the same at-risk youth.
Most of the money collected in this campaign will go directly to the project. Manufacturing and distribution costs associated with BEYONDgear products that are purchased through Indiegogo, as well as minor administrative fees will be deducted from the total collected. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for joining the BEYONDgear Movement to use adventure for good, you can continue to help by:

Wearing BEYONDgear and telling the world
Sharing our campaign on Facebook: Please like and share both the CEU facebook page and the BEYONDgear facebook page:

http://www.facebook.com/adventureforgood

http://www.facebook.com/escola.ceu



Join our newsletter:  http://eepurl.com/ry6kX

Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/beyondgear

Retweet our progress tweets every Wednesday at 2pm PST



Finally, indiegogo has told us to remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it. Join us to use adventure for good!!! 
FAQ
If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?
Just email us – info@gobeyondgear.com
What is a Stopper and why are many of our items designed around it?
A Stopper or Nut is a piece of climbing gear that protects climbers from falls. It is a tapered piece of metal that a climber lodges into a crack so it gets stuck and then connects his/her rope to it. We believe the stopper is an excellent symbol for our brand’s mission, to use adventure for good.
When will my perks be delivered?
Depends on the item but most will ship on 12:20:2012. OUR CHALK BAGS WILL NOT ARRIVE UNTIL AFTER CHRISTMAS! Please contact us if you have any questions.
What are our products made out of?
The Stopper Necklace / Bracelet is made out of pewter. The Stopper Earrings are silver plated with a surgical steel post to avoid skin allergies. The Chalk bags are partially made from recycled tents. The flexfit hats are made with 59% bamboo fiber and the rest cotton and spandex. The Tees are made from recycled plastic bottles by Playbackclothing.com and are surprisingly soft and comfortable.
Are BEYONDgear products available in retail stores?
Not yet, but soon! BEYONDgear will be in retail stores in 2013. 
Where are the products manufactured?
All of our BEYONDcharms jewelry is manufactured in Boulder, CO. Our chalk bags are made by local artisans in Peru. The hats are currently made in Vietnam. The Tees are made here in the good old USA.
Is there a charge for International Shipping?
Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally. It costs $15 per item to ship to international addresses.  If you buy a 2-item dual set it costs $25. For a Full-Set it is $40. For a Framed Photo Package it costs an extra $75 (a framed photo is a big item to ship internationally). Please include this in the checkout price.  If you forget, we'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize those details.
If you have any specific questions about your location, please email us at: info@gobeyondgear.com.

story:
Short Summary

======================================================



We are a team of people who care about the city we live in and believe that our active everyday behavior can have an impact on the problems our city faces. Problems like indifference, isolation, poverty, rudeness, ignorance, pollution or simply misery. That's why 2 years ago we created City of Errors, a video-blog where we share videos about active citizens and the things they do to care for the city and each other. 

Thanks to our videos we made friends around the world and our website recently featured in the interactive map of best city blogs by The Guardian. 


Now we want your help to turn our video-blog into a social network where users will be able to upload their own stories on how they try to make their city a livable place. Stories told by the photos and videos you upload on our website and that others will be able to share, rate, like and contribute to. 

   What We Need 

=====================================================

Up to now City of Errors has been running 100% on volunteer work. And we have exhausted all our skills, even the new ones we got working on this project. Now we need your help to raise 22.000$ (16.000 Euros). By donating you will help us  complete the tools we've been working on and get ready to pass them to the users, who will turn this project into a social network for better cities. Your contribution will help us to:

 Hire the pros that will turn our website into a fun interactive experience rather than another WordPress site.

  Promote and develop further our smartphone app and promote it worldwide.

 Update some of our equipment, hire some extra hands and make more videos like these.

 Edit a feature documentary film called Life in a City Full of Errors. A film about the people who form part of the solutions rather than the problems of our city. 


 Is this a project about our city or every city?

=======================================================

City of Errors is a platform dedicated to the creation of livable cities. It was born in Athens, a city full of errors, because it needed it a lot. We needed it a lot. We needed to connect with those who had not accepted the idea of living in decadent cities. And who fought against indifference. In every aspect of city life. 

We realized that we are not alone. That there is many of us all over the world. People who refuse to leave their street, neighborhood or city to turn grey and lonely. 

Our aim is to give every citizen of every city the space in our platform to share ideas, examples and lessons on how to be part of the solutions rather than the problems of our city and any big city.

To show to the entire world that it is the simple little things we do that make cities livable and vibrant.


   The Impact

=========================================================

Cities are defined first and foremost by our behavior.The decisions we do or don't take. And it's often what we don't do that makes us part of the problems of our cities. Sometimes we need a little push. A reason or person that will show us how to be considerate, giving, responsible or simply active human. 

Your contribution will help us complete the tools that give that push that so many of us need. Fun, engaging and interactive tools.

Cities cannot change overnight. But we believe that others' stories, can affect the way we act. See the world differently. Even reshape our behavior. And a change in behaviors can ultimately bring a change to our cities.  

You can read more our goal here. 


  Other Ways You Can Help

===============================================================

Even if you can’t donate to City of Errors, you can actively contribute to our campaign by helping us extend and develop our international network of friends and collaborators. Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools located under the video to share this project with your friends. You'll be helping us get our message across: 

WE are the solution to the problems of our cities.

story:
What It's All About

Food is medicine, preventative medicine.  A proper, healthy diet, exercise and meditation practiced together can prevent most illnesses.  Our medical system does not provide enough of this information and awareness, educating doctors only to diagnose disease and to treat it with expensive drugs, surgeries and other traditional treatments.  It certainly does not take a holistic approach that treats not only the body but the mind and the spirit, something that, to me, is essential for overall well being.  I intend to offer this holistic approach to clients and to the general public as well as to doctors, clinics and other healthcare professionals as well as to those in the sports industry.  I especially want to bring it to schools and to parents and to any and all who would like to live a long, healthy and happy life.

Where the Funds Will Go

The funds from this project will be going toward items needed for this business, such as:

 

  • nutrition school and certification     

  • school materials

  • business cards

  • a business phone

  • a web site

  • advertising

  • various venues for lectures and workshops

  • signs, fliers, posters

  • other basic business set up expenses

  • purchasing various inventory items for resale

  • some living expenses while studying

  • some travel expenses

…and would allow me a bit of personal financial freedom while studying and to set up a working, profitable practice.  All the while, I would be assisting others and, through them, the world in these trying times.  This is the reason I am asking for the amount published here, which also takes into consideration taxes as well as other fees incurred.

This would give me a good year’s start into a new, exciting and satisfying career.

About the Nutrition School

Here’s a little bit about the school.  It is a year long, online course.  It is fully accredited and participated in by such teachers as Dr. Deepak Chopra, Dr. Andrew Weil and Dr. Wayne Dyer and its founder, Joshua Rosenthal.  The school takes a holistic approach to health and nutrition, which is what attracted me to it and got me excited about it.

The Perks

Perks, other than counseling, can be expected within two months or sooner after funding has been received.  Counseling can be expected within 6 to 8 months after funding has been received.  This gives me a chance to get into the course and to get things rolling on all levels, business and personal, and to accumulate the necessary knowledge to counsel others in the best way possible.

As always, if you are unable to help fund this project, please feel free to share it with others.  I would like to thank you in advance for your time, consideration and your assistance in helping me to help myself and to help others.

There are pictures of some of the perks in the Gallery section here.

Note:  Professional, Certified Nutritionists receive $100 per hour or more for personal consultations.

More on What the Funds Will Do

I will also use a portion of the funds received to contribute to some of the other worthwhile campaigns here, thereby giving back to the community that is giving to me, and to some other good causes, funding permitting.

If I do not reach my goal, whatever funds I do raise will still go toward furthering my career and assisting me to become independent once again.  I will try to honor the perks. Whether or not it will be feasible will depend upon the amount raised.  So, it is all up to you.

Here Is My Intention Statement

It is my intention to use my knowledge and talents to help others personally and on a broader scale for the mutual benefit and the good health of all.

For this, I need your help to attend this year long, online nutrition course that offers a holistic approach for body, mind and spirit.  

I would like to incorporate this nutritional education into a holistic health business, Tai Chi Basket, which includes teaching Tai Chi and offers spiritual counseling as well, for a complete wellness experience.  These offerings will be a la carte or all three in the basket.  While I have the knowledge, an obstacle, beside the lack of funds, has been that so many need to see that piece of paper, the credentials, the certificate from having graduated a nutritional course.  I already have the other certifications.  So, that is what I am going after, my certificate for nutrition counseling.  It is also a plus that the program I will be using assists its students with getting clients as well as with setting up their own business.  I intend to set up my business as a holistic health practice for all age groups and as education for groups, such as schools, businesses and other institutions for living consciously.  The intention is for longevity and a healthy mind, body and spirit with which to enjoy it.

 

A FEW TESTIMONIALS

"I have known Solange Silverman for over five years, and she is one of the most lovely women I have ever met.  She assisted me with my spiritual center when she had just lost her home one year prior.  Her heart is made of gold, and, like many of us, she has been through a lot of trials and tribulations.  What struck me the most was that Solange always kept her strength, beauty and courage even during rough times.  If you can help Solange to go to this fascinating school, so she can help others and be proud of her education, it would be a blessing to her and the world."


Reverend Dr. Debra Savitt
Dance In The Light Spiritual Center
Dr. of Chiropractic  
Serenity Hospice Chaplain

 

“Solange is a very compassionate and patient person and teacher. I enjoyed being her Tai Chi student before her move, and I greatly miss her tutelage. She is very competent, talented, and skilled in her practice and in our classes, she always gave each student personalized and special attention. In fact, many of her students had unique health issues, which were empathically and well addressed. She helped us all learn easily and with humor, which made it fun. All her students seem to love her and her teaching methods and I greatly benefited both physically and spiritually with her help. I would highly recommend Solange to anyone.” March 23, 2012

Top qualities: Great Results, Personable, Expert

Dr. Jamie Kirkpatrick, PsyD, MFT

 

“Whatever Solange does, she brings her entire heart and soul to ... Whatever healing or growth modality that she practices, she brings a sense of wholeness and acceptance to the person she is working with that places the individual into the PERFECT spirit and mindset to achieve their goals. Solange is a tender, loving spirit on a well-defined path towards her own authentic enlightenment and the joy of bringing others along on their path.” March 14, 2012

Jayne Carilo, Owner/Consultant, Jayne Elizabeth Consulting

“Solange is highly recommended for her ability to organize and identify areas that need work and concentration... she brings ease and enjoyment to everything she encounters." March 15, 2012

Valerie Garcia, Commercial Property Manager, RAMCAL

 

“I worked side by side with Solange over the course of about two years. Her amazing sensitivity was evident when she was with a client or just associating with us, her colleagues. In her work, sensitivity is not just nice, it's essential.” March 14, 2012

James Coleman, Professional Counselor, Author, Lecturer, Self Employed

 

 

 

 

 

Video Credits:

Sliced Fruit Artwork by Dennis Wojtkiewicz

Garden Tomatoes by Artist Snake Jagger

story:
Summary

My name is Ryan Hopkins.  By trade I am a mechanical designer, with eight years experience in a wide range of manufacturing-related roles.  I have suffered from cervical scoliosis stemming from a sports injury at the age of 10.  Now 32, my daily life is affected by the pain, limitation and imbalance of scoliosis.  I have been given the opinion by several spinal specialists and chiropractors that my only eventual option will be to undergo spinal fusion surgery to fuse the two vertebrae in my neck that have not grown properly through puberty due to my childhood injury.  I find this situation unacceptable and this has caused me to use my design expertise to search for an alternative, both for myself, and for others who suffer from scoliosis.

The most basic form of my invention is envisioned as a therapeutic device usable by medical professionals in the longterm treatment of scoliosis and other mechanical spinal disorders.  The device in its most basic form will consist of a plurality of padded cradles, precisely adjustable in position, designed to provide support to each vertebra in the spine.  This is a total departure from the current state of the art in spinal corrective therapeutic devices.

Scoliosis is a serious medical problem that can have debilitating consequences.  Preventative and corrective therapies can help scoliosis patients achieve a better outcome in terms of their longterm quality of life.  Children who develop scoliosis are at highest risk for developing further complications later in life. 

My aim is to develop a spinal therapeutic system that surpasses currently available therapies in its effectiveness.  This device can help to improve the quality of life for many scoliosis patients who heretofore have had little or no recourse except awkward ineffective and uncomfortable braces, and potentially dangerous spinal fusion therapies. 

The potential that this concept has for giving scoliosis patients back their freedom of motion and lessening of their pain, is of immeasurable value to those who suffer from this disease every day.  What would it mean to you to lessen or live without pain that would otherwise plague you for the rest of your life?

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking US$10,000 over a term of 90 days for the first stage of development, which will cover costs for a patent application, cad design, machining and assembly of components for the prototype, alpha development and testing of the prototype computer control system, and intensive metrics and safety testing of the prototype.

There are ways you can contribute without committing money!  I am seeking partnerships with organizations dedicated to scoliosis awareness, and with chiropractors and back specialists to assist in informing the system's design.

If I am unable to reach the funding goal, the balance of the funds raised will go toward the patent application and development of the concept so that, once I am able to secure further investment in the future, the ptototype can then be developed and tested.

The Impact

This therapeutic system will affect tangible improvement in the health conditions for many scoliosis patients, which will allow them to lead fuller lives with less pain due to the longterm supportive and preventative maintenance that the system can provide.  If you suffer from scoliosis or know someone who does, you can understand the pain and frustration experienced by the lack of advanced therapeutic options to treat scoliosis and other spinal injuries and diseases.

Other Ways You Can Help

If my campaign speaks to you, please share it with your friends and family!  Thank you for your generosity in supporting my dream to help scoliosis patients live better lives!

story:
The Idea

The Patchwork Flag is our emblem for creating something new from what's already there. It's about bringing together a cross-cutting network of people dedicated to life-long learning and community in the city of New Orleans.

We're committed to two interrelated ideas:

  • life-long learning -- This means more than just taking classes once you're out of school. It means continuing to discover and rediscover new ways of looking at things. We want people to mix it up, get out of their everyday routine and try something new. We want to learn from each other. We want to be intellectually, spiritually, emotionally stimulated.
  • cross-cutting community -- Too often, people get stuck in tracks, in terms of the ways they look at the world and the people they spend all their time with. We all do this. With the Patchwork Flag Project, we'll create a structure that brings people together from all over, that opens up the idea of what community can be both on the local neighborhood level and city-wide.

The Plan

For six weeks over the summer, from June 25 to August 3, we'll bring together a group of twenty people from all over the city -- different neighborhoods, age groups, ethnicities, backgrounds, etc. We'll meet in different community and public spaces two times each week. The program is made up of three parts:

  • Building cross-cutting community -- as a group, we'll get to know each other, we'll eat together, we'll share our stories and our thoughts about New Orleans.
  • Learning together -- Five times over the course of the project, guest teachers, artists, and professionals will give workshops on skills like mediation, urban planning, movement, program design, and public art.
  • Developing a public project or event -- As a group, we will collaborate on a structure that advances life-long learning and cross-cutting community in the broader New Orleans public. Doing so will enact those ideas in our group: we'll have to look at things in new ways and collaborate with each other to make this final component happen.

Related to our philosophy of community-based, non-instituitional learning, is our use of bartering. Our program partners with multiple community organizations -- including Tekrema Center for Art and Culture and Ashe Cultural Arts Center. In exchange for space and other resources, our group will support their programming, volunteering and working with them. This will be an optional part of our project, outside of the two meeting times per week, but it will expand our resources and networks in the city by establishing relationships with these organizations.

In the first weeks of the project, we'll literally make our Patchwork Flag, sewing together our individual patches. Wherever we go, we'll bring the flag, making the process as visible and public as possible.

The Impact

These six weeks are just a beginning. We're hoping that the connections we make with each other as a group, and with people involved in other community organizations, will be the start of long-standing relationships. The project is meant to explode out, and to inspire other people to do exactly what we're doing -- coming up with an idea to promote community and innovation, and just rolling with it. Also, as of now we're planning on repeating the project seasonally or at least once a year. We'll see where this goes, but this six-week workshop will hopefully grow into a more permanent collaborative structure.

Who Are We?

We're both about to graduate from Bennington College, where we've spent lots of time studying and thinking about community, public practice in the arts, and non-traditional, hands-on education. Sara, born and raised in NOLA, studied Dance and African American Studies with a focus on Community Development, and has worked with groups including Urban Bushwomen, a dance company that focuses on social justice issues in the African American community. Ezra's from Denville, NJ, and at Bennington he studied the social function of theater and the arts, most recently working with the Los Angeles Poverty Department, a community-based theater group in Skid Row, Los Angeles.

As you can probably guess, both of us are fresh-faced, enthusiastic, and committed. We also have plenty of experience leading projects and working with community at Bennington and beyond. Our college incorporates a 7-week internship term into the school year, so we've each had four experiences pursuing these questions of community and learning outside of college.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, that's totally OK. Since the basis of the project is people working with each other in community and collaboration, you can be a part of that for free. Here's how:

  • Teach a workshop -- We're still looking for someone to teach a workshop on mediation and conflict resolution
  • Barter with us -- Do you have any skills, advice, or resources you think we could use? Do you need anything for your own community that we could provide? Let us know!
  • Be a part of our community -- We already have a small extended family of Patchwork Flag people, from folks who have picked our brains about the project to people who are full-on partners. If you're interested and you have any creative ideas about how to help, let us know!
  • Spread the word -- If you know anyone who might be interested in the project in any way, please pass it on!

 

LOVE AND THANKS!!!!!

Sara & Ezra

story:
FLOW Office Wisdom believes that business has an important role to play in healing the world.  We are a social enterprise:  we’re a for-profit business with a purpose.  We have made a deliberate decision to walk the walk and make change happen.  We want to inspire, challenge and even insist that other for-profits do the same. 

Here’s how we work:  FLOW has a talented team skilled in business administration, project management, communications and strategic business services.  We love helping small business owners and not-for-profits follow their passion and do what makes their hearts sing, while we take care of the details they don’t have time or energy to handle. 

That’s the enterprise part.  Here’s the social part:  we give back 10% of our gross revenue in staff time to causes that need our help.   Our paying clients support our donated time on organizations such as The Hunger Project-Canada, Madagascar School Project, Original People’s Vision for a United Community and On Butterfly Wings, which is our line-up of social causes so far. 

See how it works?  Our paying clients—we think of them as partners—enable us to keep on doing good for the social causes we support.  We are committed to proving that business and profit go hand-in-hand with social good.
 

FLOW began with the dream of April Burrows, FLOW's founder, and her determination to start a business to support small businesses and solo-preneurs who found themselves overwhelmed or under-inspired by the day-to-day tasks of running their businesses.  At the same time, April kept encountering skilled and gifted women who were un- or under-employed, and looking for challenge or meaningful work.  And so—the FLOW team was formed.

We are part-way through our first year in business, and we have certainly seen success.  Our target market has welcomed us with open arms, and the work that our clients have brought us has enabled us to provide financial assistance, marketing strategy, moral support, and encouragement to the first social cause we chose to support, The Hunger Project - Canada. 

We want next year to be even better:  we want to attract more work and a more diverse clientele so we can provide greater assistance to our causes.  We need $30,000 to achieve the level of effectiveness that we envision.  We will use the money to

  • create a video and/or infographic to explain our business model, raise awareness of the benefits of social enterprise, and market FLOW by showing clients how hiring us makes their dollars go further.
  • support an increase in hours for two of our part-time staff so they can spend more time building our business.

By expanding our reach further, FLOW can enable and empower more small businesses and not-for-profits to be effective agents of change.  The more people who jump on the bandwagon, the better the outcome for everyone.  You can play a key role by contributing to this campaign.  We count on, and look forward to your collaboration and friendship.

If you’re not sure of our commitment, maybe this will help:  FLOW will give back, in staff time, 10% of the funds raised here over the next two years.  That’s in addition to our ongoing commitment of 10% of gross revenue.    Everybody wins.


                              

We want to be the catalyst for inspiring more and more businesses to join the many voices that are saying there is another way–and it includes everyone.  We believe there are enough resources on the planet for all people to live abundant lives.  Everybody at FLOW wants to earn a fair wage to sustain ourselves, be healthy and save enough for a rainy day—but we want to be intentional about how we decide how much is enough. When “enough” becomes “excess” then we’re being motivated by self-interest and fear, and have lost sight of the common good.  We encourage business owners and individuals alike to be conscious of their choices and test those choices against our values and mission, and the common good.  

We find our inspiration in many places: Oprah Winfrey, the Keilburger Brothers in the “Me to We” movement, Mahatma Ghandi, Jesus, the Dalai Lama.  Maybe now you see why.


If you aren’t in a position right now to contribute financially, we get that.  We also get that creating change in this world is not all about money.  Here are some ways that you can help the FLOW team achieve our goals:

  • Share this campaign with your contacts
  • Go to thp.org and learn all you can about The Hunger Project and their work.  We already know you will find it inspiring and you won’t be able to help but spread the word about them.
  • Check out our website and familiarize yourself with our services.  And then spread the word, talk us up, and send us some client referrals!
  • Smile at people.  Hold doors for them.  Invite your neighbors in for coffee.  Leave encouraging notes in people’s mailboxes.  Be the change.

story:
Are You Ready To Burn?

We are BurnReady, a team of college students from across different majors at the University of Nevada, Reno. We love everything about Burning Man, the culture, the message, the community--and most of all, the people that make it awesome!

We'd like to burn (that might come out weird) but some of us are virgins (also, might sound weird, bear with me). The problem was, most of us hadn't a clue as to how to prepare for Burning Man. To add onto that, we'd heard countless horror stories of empty shelves and chaos at the stores when it came time to prepare. 

You see, each year, nearly 70,000 people come to Burning for a life-changing week out in the desert, many for the first time in their lives. It literally becomes one of the biggest cities in Nevada for a short period of time. That also means a city's worth of durable desert supplies that Reno stores need to accommodate for. The week before, thousands of attendees flood the stores and camping aisles looking for the things they need. However, many people are left without the essentials to survive the harsh desert conditions, or they find them after endless hours store-hopping and stressing, hours that they could have spent enjoying the community or making their gifts. 

BurnReady aims to make this process as simple as possible. With our service, attendees will be able to order all of their survival supplies online, have it organized into one, convenient package, then just pick it up on the way to the event. It's that easy. And the best part? Most people won't want to truck back or store all of their supplies, so we came up with a solution: ReBurn.

With ReBurn, users will be able to sell us back certain items from their packages once they return from the event. They can get up to 10% back based on the condition of the products, as well as an in-store discount on their next package. ReBurn will allow burners to take more responsibility for their items and help them "leave no trace", as well as give them something back for being green. We'll reuse the stuff we can for discounted "used" packages next year, then recycle or donate the rest. 

We want to get Burners out into the desert and have as immediate an experience as possible. Burning Man holds a magical, special place in many people's hearts, including our own, and BurnReady aims to help share that magic and keep the experience as stress-free as possible. 


What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise 15K for our service. It will go towards warehouse storage rent, truck rentals for logistics, and the supplies needed to fill our first orders for Burning Man 2015.

For your support, we want to give all the people who donated or supported us a very special gift: An e-book that showcases the marvelous gifts that people have received on the playa and beyond, with the stories and meaning behind all of them. 

Beyond that, the perks for donating to us include things from neat party accessories like light-up drink cups and laser glasses to mini-survival packages that are ready to be used in the desert to a VIP fundraising party where we'll rave through the night the weekend before Burning Man! The point is, we want everyone to have a great time throughout this campaign, and anything we can do to make the most out of your donations is a major win for both parties.

The Impact

With your help, we can change the future of Burning Man prep for the better by innovating it today, while still keeping in mind the history and rich culture that's shaped it into what it is now. BurnReady has the potential to prepare thousands of innovators, dreamers, artists, and world-changers for the experience of a lifetime. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help us in other ways, or you've already donated and want to support us further, we need your help in our first-of-its-kind "crowdgifting" campaign. 

Here's How It Works

 We want to give everyone who's helped with our campaign a gift that reflects the beauty and love this community selflessly offers. To start, we encourage anyone who'd like to help to send us a picture of a gift. It could be anything at all, something you got at the Playa, something you've just made, or even something you've been holding on to for a long time. Just send it to our PO Box: 8909 Reno, NV, 89507 or to our email at moneill.burnready@gmail.com. In addition, we encourage everyone to attach a story or background behind that gift and what it means to you. When the campaign's over, we'll collect all the gifts and stories and turn it into an ebook that we'll give out to everyone who's helped kickstart this service.

story:
STOP WASTING OUR MONEY IN THE EU

Did you know that each month the European Parliament, all 751 MEPs, members of their staff, members of EU bureaucracy (more than 5,000 people) move from the facilities in Brussels, to the traditional seat of the Parliament in Strasbourg for just 4 days? The cost for this move is an estimated 130-170 millions euros per month and 10,000 cubic meters of CO2 annually. It is an blunt EU taxpayers money waste issue and therefore we as liberals, libertarians need to play an active role to bring common sense back in the EU.

We want to save your money wasted on one of the most absurd idea in EU. Together we can stop parliamentarians and bureaucrats from constant travel between Strasburg and Brussel. We can make them  work in one place . All we have to do is to raise a million signatures from at least 7 countries. Than we will force EU to take in on the floor and star serious debate on the waste. Start with supporting our campaign promoting our social media activities and participating in our crowdfunding. We need every euro to spread the idea and collect even more  signatures. It starts today with your one euro.

What does it mean if we succeed in raise 1 million EU signatures?

It would mean that we, as European citizens would be able to ask of the EU to legislate an end to this waste and to publicly take a stand. This is an issue which is emblematic of EU wasting taxpayers Money. It also gives the opportunity of raising accountability, transparency and less burreaucracy inside the EU structure.

How we will do it?

Our crowdfunding campaign will enable us to raise funds to successfully gather the 1,000,000 signatures by launching an online campaign with Change.org and on the streets of the main cities in each participant country. This will allow us to raise awareness for the issue.

Join us and help as bring common sense back in the EU! 

We look forward to standing shoulder to shoulder with you and moving forward with this campaign against EU waste.

Yours in Liberty,

Roxana Nicula, Michael Iakovidis and Tomasz Wróblewski.

story:
Hi everyone, 

My name is Shereen Kostmayer.  I am a single mom of two girls, and I have lived here on the Coast my whole life.  I opened the Biloxi location of Southern Bound Book Shop in June 2013 with a dream to create something successful and beloved by the community.  I began by selling used books only because resale has always been near and dear to my heart.  As time went on, I ventured into ordering new books, learning the business as I went.  It became clear that Ocean Springs was in need of an indie bookstore, and the people would be terrific supporters.  

At this time, the book shop has no debt (aside from a little owed to small publishers) and is 1-2 years away from being profitable.  Our little Ocean Springs book shop is up and running, but it is still not fully stocked with books and sidelines.   Available resources to open were minimal, but that didn't stop me!  However, the selection is small and more stock is desperately needed.  This is why I am turning to you, the community, to support your new indie book shop and help me fill the shelves.  If the shelves stay full, the sales will follow.  We can then continue to host more community events such as story time, book clubs, and author book signings.  We are ready to be the community hub that indies are in other places, but I need your assistance!

story:
The Problem:

For women living on the border of Armenia and Azerbaijan, personal health and wellbeing are rarely a priority. Lack of employment combined with constant sniper fire makes it extremely challenging for women to stay in their homes, let alone take care of themselves.


These women only see a doctor once they have discovered a health issue which is often already at an advanced stage. Many of these afflictions are very treatable, but only if they are caught in the beginning stages. This is why women (and men) need to take preventative measures and ensure that they are screened regularly for generic reproductive health issues.


However, along the border there are no local health clinics that provide gynaecological services or mammograms. This means that in order to get any type of medical attention, women have to travel all the way to Yerevan, and for many this is simply not possible.


Yet they want to stay in their villages; the places they were born and grew up and have lived their entire lives. And we want to help them. We want to make it possible for them to live happy and healthy lives with their families in their homes.


The Solution:

The Berd Women’s Resource Center Foundation identified this problem and asked us at the Homeland Development Initiative Foundation to help them resolve it. If women on the border can have easier access to the tools and education they need in order to stay healthy, then it will be easier for them to stay in their homes.


Together, we are raising the funds needed for women in the villages of Berkaber, Nerkin Karmiraghbyur, Aygepar, Movses and Berd, to be able to have access to these tools and education.


With the money raised we will be able to bring sonography equipment to the border and over the course of several days, women will be able to come and get screened for free. If after this preliminary screening they find any irregularities, we will bring them to Yerevan for further testing.


How It Works:


  • Women in border villages will crochet key tags in the shape of their dream home. The key tags will be used as the rewards in this campaign, creating an income for the women.

  • The profit from each key tag will go towards gynaecological services and mammograms for women from those villages.
It's that simple.


Each house key tag is valued at $10. 
Of this: 
$3.20 goes to the woman who made the key tag of her home.  
$3.00 goes to the Berd Womens Resource Center Foundation for planning and implementation of the women's health program.
$1.80 goes to the Homeland Development Initiative Foundation for its coordination of this campaign. 
$1.20 goes to HayPost, for getting the key tag rewards to you! See pt. F below.
$.80 goes to Indiegogo as an administrative cost. 
If we are able to raise $10.000 by getting pledges for 1000 key tags, we have reached our goal! 


The questions: 
A) Who are the the Berd Womens Resource Center Foundation? https://www.facebook.com/berdwomen/?fref=ts. Famous for their Berd Bears project, the BWRCF are a major force for positive change in the Berd region of Tavoush province. 


B) Who are the Homeland Development Initiative Foundation? https://www.facebook.com/HDIFarmenia/?fref=ts. With over a dozen partner projects around Armenia, HDIF engages with vulnerable families- at the front line, refugees, ethnic minorities, the disabled, in the earthquake zone and more. 


C) Who are the beneficiaries of this project
1. The crocheters: 

In Berkaber- Armine Eganian, Arpine Janvelyan. Rita Harutyunyan, Gayane Davidova

In Nerkin Karmiraghbyur- Leyli Qocharyan with her sister Nvard Qocharyan

In Aygepar- Shushan Dallakyan

In Movses- Anzhela Ayvazyan, Kima Ayvazyan 

In Berd- Nelly Goqoryan, Zhanna Eghikyan, Hasmik Kiziryan, Aspram Papyan


2. The ladies getting medical checks:
As many women from the region as the funds raised allows. When we raise $10.000, then 200 women will have their medical checks.


D) The Dream Houses!
1. Nerkin Karmiraghbyur- just a few meters from the front line, this key tag symbolises the hope for peace.


2. Aygepar- right on the trenches at the front line, Aygepar has an airstrip that cannot be used due to sniping. Thus, this key tag has a plane on the roof.


3. Movses- under constant sniping, the women of Movses know how to evacuate their homes in two minutes. Their key tag is a peaceful gingerbread house.


4. Berkaber- a centre of honey production, Berkaber is perched very close to the front line. The honey is harvested during quiet periods.


E) Where are the gynaecological and mammography tests to be done? Both are to be done at a clinic in Yerevan, as there is no facility for testing in Tavoush province.


F) Can I just make a donation and not have the key tags sent? Yes! Please just indicate that on your pledge. This would in fact save us our postage cost, which would then earmarked back into the women's health project. You can request that the key tags be given to a local cause that you yourself can identify if you so choose.


G) I will be in Armenia this Summer, can I visit the Berd Women's Resource Center? Sure! Contact Anahit Badalianh at bwrcfound@gmail.com.  HDIF is always open for visitors at the Impact Hub in Yerevan or at info@hdif.org. 


Our big thanks go out to the students of the Manana Film Center in Yerevan who made the film clip teaser and the full length film(coming a bit later) that have been made in connection with this campaign.  Thanks also go the Amerian Armenian Wellness Center for their cooperation.


Please spread the word, share the campaign, get your women's group involved, your church group involved, your friends involved... Let's together make life a bit easier for Anzhela and the other women in the villages along the border.

story:
We plan to build an aluminum-bodied, all-electric concept car. We are high school students from Houston, Texas, and we have developed our vision of a radical performance car to the fullest extent that our resources will allow.

The project started off as a joke between friends. In an attempt to trump each other with ridiculous ideas, one member of our team suggested 3D printing a full-sized car. The idea evolved into a feasible possibility, and, within a week, our team had created a rough 3D model.

We have designed the car completely from scratch. It’s features are, to say the least, unconventional. It features a unique driving position and a novel steering mechanism to accommodate such a position. Accompanying, the car is a D3O padded, Nomax® driving suit to protect the driver. The car’s structural components will be made mainly from machined aluminum. Parts that are not vital to its structural integrity will be 3D printed. The electric power unit will include a Li-ion battery pack—there will be no direct emissions—and two motors coupled directly to the rear wheels. The underbody is shaped to produce actual aerodynamic downforce, and channeled air will cool the power unit. Each of our team members identifies just as much as an artist as he OR she does an aspiring engineer. So, unlike many student engineering projects, the car will look sleek and professional.

Now, before we can start building and testing, we have to fundraise. We don’t need much—we can produce most of our parts in house—but we need to cover the cost of materials. And, the more resources we have to work with, the cooler we can make this car. We greatly appreciate any support you can give us. We have set huge goals for ourselves, and, with your support, we have every intention to achieve them.

story:
Aaniin Niijii (Greetings Friends) - we have extended our plan and investment. Please support us by visiting our website.

 

For most of my life, I have been fighting bad ideas.  From power lines to pipelines, I have engaged in processes set up to permit pollution and not protect the public.   The time has come to stop being reactive and become proactive. I have made a commitment to grow the future, to grow hope.  Omaa Akiing --on the land to which the people belong-- we are doing that.  I am so thankful for your support and hope you will join us as we move ahead.

Let me tell you our story.

Last summer, I put a call out for support to help bring my vision of a new economy for my reservation to life.  The response was overwhelming, and we far exceeded our fundraising goals. The interest we garnered has inspired us to keep going and keep sharing.  

This spring, I have been blessed to be supported in my goals by a number of folks helping to make my field of dreams a reality.  We have put our hearts, minds, and bodies to the beauty of bringing life -- seeds and hope. We began cultivating our farm with prayers, tobacco, our hands, horses, and a small tractor.  This is just the beginning.

With the power of love and commitment, people have come together to plant our heritage varieties of corn, beans, potatoes, squash, Jerusalem artichokes, and tobacco - asema - as it is called in Anishinaabemowin.  Winona’s Hemp and Heritage Farm is coming alive. Our barn and store are painted and ready, our fields are full of fiber and vegetables, and we are ready to move to the next step- processing our hemp.

Winona’s Hemp and Heritage Farm also helps to support the Anishinaabe Agricultural Institute (AAI).  This project is inspired by my father, who ran an agricultural research station for years. At AAI we are working on many projects, including horse-powered agriculture.  Our region has a deep and long relationship with the Horse Nation, which we are working to re-invigorate with our relatives to the west- the Dakotas. For the last four years, we have been riding with the Dakotas to oppose bad ideas proposed by the Enbridge corporation; but now we are riding with the Dakotas to spread horse medicine.  Horses are sacred beings and the Dakotas are teaching us their horse songs and how to use the horse medicine. Our hope is to use our herd for healing our communities and our land. We are grateful for these relationships and remembering our long-time relatives.

     
After growing hemp for the last three years, this year's harvest promises to be the most bountiful.  I've spent the last year networking with other hemp growers and have learned a lot. I’ve expanded the varieties I am growing and now have several small pilot plots of CBD and fiber varieties.  My main interest is in fiber and fabric, but I know this plant to be a medicine and want to provide this medicine to my community that desperately needs healing.  Securing seeds for fabric varieties has been especially difficult.  We are not sure if this is a result of the Trump Administration, but we have persevered. In a gift from Gitchi Manidoo,  I was granted access to the White Earth tribal field.  

 

This field is where my Tribe, the White Earth Nation, planted several hemp varieties last year.  They had great success in growing, and this year, the field re-seeded itself. These “volunteer” plants are now in their second year of adaptation our northern Minnesota climate.   Some of that hemp is eight feet tall. We are now harvesting the stalks for fiber and letting some go to seed. We intend to expand these cultivars and anticipate growing wild varieties from Nebraska and Minnesota to strengthen our seed stock. Our goal is to develop quality hemp fiber varieties adapted to our climate.   

This is the field of dreams and the growing of hope for our region.

Hemp has a long history on this land, and Minnesota once hosted eleven hemp mills.  Those mills are no longer here, but they are remembered by elders in northern Minnesota; elders whose families made rope, or clothing.  These memories are memories of a locally grown economy.  We remember this story and are working to bring it back.  We also recognize the Indigenous leaders who have urged a return to hemp- John Trudell and Alex White Plume.  Indeed, Indigenous people have a long history with hemp. The name “Tuscarora” refers to People of the Hemp shirts, I am told.  

A generous donation from Project Earth has allowed us to purchase a small industrial decorticator --the machine needed to separate the fiber from the rest of the hemp stalk.  We will move this decorticator from farm to farm as we build a local economy, an artisan economy. Once the hemp is decorticated, we need to spin that fiber into thread-- so my new ask is to help me develop my thread mill.  I have found a perfect building for my needs- a small industrial building in Callaway, Minnesota. Callaway is on the western edge of the White Earth Reservation, near the Tribal Hemp field and a major North-South railroad line.  Callaway is also a perfect place for wind and solar power.

This is my next hope- to purchase the building within which we will house our thread and rope making factory.  

The building I want to purchase is $81,000. With your help, we can raise that. We will also need support to buy the thread and rope making equipment.  While we still researching where to find this equipment, we know the last hemp rope making operation in the US was here in Minnesota at Stillwater Prison.

 

I am going to grow a local economy; because that is what we all need to do. I am going to work with my community and grow this mino bimaatisiiwin (the good life) back- local food, local energy, and local hemp; and we are going to share that story, and learn from our success and mistakes equally, so that this story can be re-made and told everywhere.

As I walk through the plants, I look to see which are males, which are females, and learn with the plants. They are indeed generous teachers.  The hemp is ready to come back to our economy and Omaa Akiing here on this land. I want to make rope for all of us- whether Sun Dancers, or sailors; and I want to make fabric- because this is the fiber of the past, and the future.  I want to be part of the many who will grow hope. That’s what we must do -- grow hope and our future.
 

Support us:

Our Seven Generations and Seventh Fire prophecies tell us we are in the time when we have a choice between two paths.  One path is well worn, scorched and leads to our destruction. The other path is new, green and leads to mino-bimaadiziwin (the good life).  We must choose to walk the new path.

It’s time for the next economy.  That economy is going to be kind and restore our Mother Earth. This last fall, more than 800 people became supporters and invested in Winona’s Hemp and Heritage Farm. That’s how we are going to build the next economy and we are asking you to support us as we light the next eighth fire and build the economy.

Please join us and invest in Winona’s Hemp.

Miigwech, 

Winona LaDuke
