story:
About the Campaign: A Names Dictionary

To the Yorubas (and most African cultures), a name is not just a name. Names have meanings. Names are powerful. Names are an embodiment of history, of a family, of a lineage. (More here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoruba_culture#Naming ). Sadly, today our names are being washed away by "civilisation". We are raising children who are ignorant of this power (or meaning) of their names. Soon, one child at a time, a Yoruba name will be lost. Soon, one name at a time, the significance of the naming tradition will disappear. 

Or not! We can't let this happen. (The video above is meant to illustrate the difference between how names are written and how they are pronounced; and a popular Nigerian attitude to mispronunciation of their names).

This project seeks to create an online multimedia database of all Yoruba names; a place of knowledge for those who need it. People removed from their homeland can look to it and find a lost connection while those not familiar with the Yoruba culture can come there to learn about Yoruba names, spelling, etymology, meanings, stories, et al; a wiki of sorts, a free web-based multimedia repository of knowledge open to all; a dictionary; a project designed to reverse a trend and preserve a culture. 

There are some websites around right now with bits and pieces of information about Yoruba names. Most of them are either hard to use, don't have enough names in it to earn the name "dictionary", don't offer users a chance to add new names that the dictionary doesn't have, don't have audio links where the user can click and hear the name pronounced, doesn't have detailed description of where the name is from, what its morphological components are, or aren't dynamic enough to include modern names along with ancient ones.

There are two parts to this project. The first part is the initial database created from easily accessible sources: books, radio, television, internet publications, twitter, visitor logs, passenger manifests, etc. The second is the crowd-sourced entries created by users around the world, which will then be vetted by other users and by site administrators. These entries will then be edited for appropriate presentation, and an audio file added, among other things. These parts are equally important to the success of the project.


What the Dictionary will Look Like

"The distinction between dictionaries and encyclopedias is not only the one that is practically impossible to make, but one that is fundamentally misconceived. Dictionaries are encyclopedias." - John Haiman

  • SEARCHABILITY: Users will be able to search for names, or add their own entries
  • ETYMOLOGY: Names will have links and information about its (ethnic and geographical) origin.
  • MORPHOLOGICAL/PHONOLOGICAL INFORMATION: Like most dictionaries, this one will have relevant morphological and phonological/phonetic information. This will be of help to linguists and other academic users.
  • AUDIO SOUNDS: Users will be able to click on names and hear the correct (and alternative) pronunciation. The sounds will be recorded by paid (or volunteer) voiceover artists. 
  • ALTERNATE SPELLINGS: Names that have alternative spellings will be highlighted. Abbreviated names (like "Lanre", "Banke", "Tunde" etc) will also be defined in full.
  • SOURCE: Some names came from Arabic, Hausa, or European influences (names like "Bakare", "Rasaki", "Alimi", "Buraimo", etc). These will be highlighted with links and (web/audio/video) sources. 
  • STORIES: Some names carry more than what can be gleaned from their meaning. Users who know the stories related to their names will be able to edit entries in order to include it.
  • OTHER RELEVANT CULTURAL INFORMATION will be provided, e.g songs from naming ceremonies, and other information of cultural value.

What We Need 

In total, we need $5,000, for this drive, basically to pay for the website designer, and to set up the most crucial software and hardware backbones of the project. The rest, hopefully, will take care of itself (or require a different funding of its own). The breakdown is as follows:

  • We need $2000 to design the website (already purchased at www.yorubaname.com. and www.orukoyoruba.com). These are the best names available. More names will be sought out that can capture the extent of the project and still be succinct enough to be memorable.
  • $500 will be required to pay for site hosting for five years. 
  • $1000 will go into the purchase of audio equipment: microphones and other acoustic tools and software. A few of them are listed here:
      • MICROPHONE: An Audio Technica AT2020 USB Microphone: AT2020 Plus (or equivalent) http://goo.gl/31X7He
      • HAND-HELD MICS: Zoom H2N http://goo.gl/6KXR3P
      • ACOUSTIC SHIELD:http://goo.gl/RZgsAb 
      • EARPHONES: BEATS or equivalent studio-style headphone:http://goo.gl/4O2Esu
  • $1500 will go to other incidentals (transportation for field workers, stipend for social media volunteers, cost of photocopy, scanning, internet, studio rentals, etc.) and also to purchase books (like this: http://goo.gl/1z5vPa and http://goo.gl/xQ6w90 and http://goo.gl/NUef5X) and other helpful materials.
However, as much as $5000 will be most helpful, this drive is set up in such a way that even if we don't reach this entire goal, whatever is raised (especially anything above $1500) will be spent to design the online database so that the project can, even as a purely crowd-sourced project, be able to kick off and build from the ground-up. 


The Impact

From a micro point of view, this project provides a valuable space of knowledge for anyone interested in the structure, form, pronunciation, etymology, meaning, and style of Yoruba names. At the larger level, it is meant to start a crucial documentation process for much of our African experience. Think of future iterations: A Multimedia Dictionary of Igbo Names, Swahili Names, etc. Or, even better: a crowd-sourced Yoruba Lexical Dictionary (that captures not just names this time but all the lexical items in the language). 

In a little way, we would be saving one language from extinction (even though it currently has over 30 million speakers (ethnologue.com). As a Yoruba speaker, we would be building a valuable legacy for the coming generation, and knowledge that can prove useful for others in some other part of the world.

Like the Tweet Yoruba Project, this will be another contribution to the documentation (and eventual survival) of the language in the 21st century and beyond. Not just for Yoruba, but for indigenous languages everywhere.


Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. The project will thrive on demand. As long as people are online looking for information about the Yoruba culture, particularly Yoruba names, there will always be people using this website to share their own knowledge that can help others.


Other Ways You Can Help

In case you can't contribute financially, please stay in touch. Your knowledge or any other tips you have may be useful in the long run. If you are also able to donate any of the tools listed, that will help too.

Also, please share this campaign and get your loved ones to chip in.

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that's all there is to it. Follow us on twitter for more.


About Me

My name is Kola Tubosun. I work in Nigeria as a teacher, linguist, and writer. There is more about me here: http://www.ktravula.com/about. In 2012, I led a successful campaign to make Twitter available in Yoruba (More about that here: http://techcabal.com/2014/11/14/twitter-yoruba/).

I've been interested in activities and projects that make Yoruba more adaptable to new technology, and conversely, those that make new technology more user-friendly to Yoruba speakers (and learners) all over the world. 

My undergraduate project from the University of Ibadan (2005) is titled "The Multimedia Dictionary of Yoruba Names", and my masters thesis, at Southern Illinois University Edwardsville (2012), focused on "Initial Tonal Acquisition by American English Speakers learning Yoruba."
story_txt:
About the Campaign: A Names Dictionary

To the Yorubas (and most African cultures), a name is not just a name. Names have meanings. Names are powerful. Names are an embodiment of history, of a family, of a lineage. (More here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoruba_culture#Naming ). Sadly, today our names are being washed away by "civilisation". We are raising children who are ignorant of this power (or meaning) of their names. Soon, one child at a time, a Yoruba name will be lost. Soon, one name at a time, the significance of the naming tradition will disappear. 
Or not! We can't let this happen. (The video above is meant to illustrate the difference between how names are written and how they are pronounced; and a popular Nigerian attitude to mispronunciation of their names).

People removed from their homeland can look to it and find a lost connection while those not familiar with the Yoruba culture can come there to learn about Yoruba names, spelling, etymology, meanings, stories, et al; a wiki of sorts, a free web-based multimedia repository of knowledge open to all; a dictionary; a project designed to reverse a trend and preserve a culture.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Joshua Merriman, I am originally from New Mexico and come from a small background, neg. no father figure growing up and many other things, but it made me a very passionate person because I had been through so much.
  • Everyday that walk down the street I see many people in need, and having been in a situation of need I understand that people need help.
  • For every $10 that is contributed to this cause is enough to feed someone, and provide a work opportunity of 1 hour, to each $10 worth of contribution.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The idea is to have the necessary vehicles, and enough money to hire a lawyer, to represent us and handle all the necessary paperwork and legal issues, etc. and to lastly launch a regularly scheduled large campaign aimed at getting the city of Los Angeles clean, while providing jobs to those that deserve a chance at a better life.
  • All of my perks, vary from the $5 range, all the way to our large contributions, for example; if you donate $5,000 you could fly a team of 5 of our people to come and spend a whole weekend cleaning a desired location, of your choice within the United States.
  • Regardless of whether I reach my goals or not, it will still be a step in the right direction, allowing us to get the most basic essentials for this Non-Profit organization lifted off the ground.

The Impact

  • This is such a great way to give back to society as a whole, it allows people to give back without needing anything but there time to clean the streets.
  • What also comes out of this is our groups idea of a greener society, utilizing solar energy.
  • We have already had 4 major clean-up dates, we have contributed about $500 of my personal money, and raised another $250 through another fundraiser which allowed us to feed 35 people home cooked Thanksgiving meals. And on Christmas we did Pancakes in the Park, at MacArthur Park here in Los Angeles, where we fed approximately 200 people, with oatmeal, pancakes, and granola bars(we thought that leaving the meat out was a more eco-friendly decision).
  • So my friends and I decided to get together, to do something positive in this world to give us a brighter tomorrow.

Risks & Challenges

 Dealing with the mentally ill and disabled people will be a challenge to overcome because of the high population of these groups of individuals that tend to populate the streets of LA.

  • Having grown up in an underprivileged background, I can relate to people on a very close level, and see people for what situations they may have experienced in life, rather than seeing people as good or bad, just an effect of the past.
  • As funding reaches the goals necessary in order to provide at least all of the basic equipment/vehicles, and also the legal issues we will be completely self sustaining at a certain point in time, allowing us the time to spend with these mentally/disabled individuals on a much more common basis.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can always share this with other people and get people to like our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/lcula
  • If your more of a "Google person" then please check out our Google page at 
  • You can use the share tools on Indiegogo in order to spread the word and help me reach a much larger audience.

And that's all there is to it.


<a href="https://plus.google.com/103752560162635036180" rel="publisher">Google+</a>

story:
Our Story

Shane merker was found dead on mothers day of unkown causes.  Shane was a father of 1 daughter and 2 step children. Shane was a very generous caring person who always gave everything he had to help others.   We are still trying to raise money for shanes boulder city memorial service shanes children will be attending and they will be dedicating a plaque in the park were he lived.  shanes mother, brothers and friends have used every dime they have to have shane cremated and getting his belongings.  We still need lots of help please donate even a few dollars helps out.  As of this point we dont have the funds to have his memorial or even attend it. Its on may 29th 1pm to 5pm   PLEASE HELP you can contribute on this site we prefer paypal either through this site or directly on paypal to brentmerker@aol.com 


The Impact

Shanes memorial and plaque dedication boulder city


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money for shanes memorial service may 29th 2pm to 5pm


Other Ways You Can Help

spread the word repost on your myspace, facebook twitter or blogs

story:
OUR STORY

Our goal is to create a user friendly website that takes of advantage of all the ways to communicate through technology including social media and smartphone applications. The main focus of the site will be to grow awareness of the downtown area of Evansville, IN. The city has been making strides in building the area for last 5 years. We see an opportunity to help the cause by creating a website that will pool the resources of all the bars and restaurants in the downtown. 

WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

Building downtown business helps to build the infrastructure of the city. This site will encourage residents to participate in downtown activities and in turn bring the need for jobs and more business to fill the need.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need capitol to advertise. We want to make this as attractive to downtown bars and restaurants as possible. We will take all their current efforts and combine them in one place and we need to tell as many people as possible. We will use most of funds earned to promote the business through all possible avenues.

We also need some cash to complete development of the website. It's almost complete, but we will need to pay graphic artist, photographers and some administrative cost.

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

There are other ways you can help. Mainly by spreading the word. If you have a local website we would love to trade links with you. Also anyone interested in nightlife in general or the growth of the downtown area feel free to tell everyone you have ever met.

story:
Auggie gave 42 years of his life to corps, to us.  

Yea...he may have smelled funky on that first day of Plebe system, but anyway you put, he was a slice of levity.  

Always smiling, always with a joke, always with a "You Noa supposa be in here.  Getta back to class."

Our full dress was pressed.  Our mackinaws sharp.  Our buttons sewn.  Our pride strong.

Let's thank Auggie for his service.  Our gift from the corps to remember him.  Let's raise $4,200 for his 42 years in 42 days.  We will present a plaque to his family and VFMAC in his honor.  Like the chapel star and the General's grave, future generals shall salute the same.

Seriously, a bronze etched Auggie would be awesome!

story:
Update: Thank you everyone!! We have reached our goal! From this point onward any money raised will go towards helping specific equipment needs that we need to provide an even higher quality show!

 

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Accendo Media is a non-profit based out of Memphis, TN that promotes the art and music community through monthly events, a record label, and (soon to be) an artist management company. We in turn take the money we make after paying bands, venues etc and donate them to local causes and charities only. The idea came about when founder, and company president Will Scheff took a step back to identify our biggest strengths, and our biggest weaknesses as a city.

 

 

Accendo aims to unify the city of Memphis around our arts and music community taking our rich and complex history and shining a light on it. We want our city to look at what is happening, and to take pride in who we are. To understand that our city is unique, and beautiful.

 

The money that you donate will go directly towards funding the 501(C)3 we need in order to be a tax exempt organization (we are already a non-profit corporation). If we meet our goal and continue to receive money, than the additional money will go towards helping us with our equipment needs. We appreciate you taking time to look at our Indiegogo page and hope that you're able to help us achieve our goal. We look forward to seeing you out and about, Memphis!

story:
Oreos to Fight Intolerance 

My name is Joe Gibson I am a married father of two. I have been through stretches of homelessness in my life and I also identify as a bisexual person. I feel that any donations for any reason are welcome to people in that situation. This is an important cause because with this we can do a little good in the world and also show people that someone isn't a bad person because their lifestyle is different from theirs. I have many friends who are part of the LGBTQ community and the reaction that we all saw from people on Facebook earlier today was awful and insulting. I also promise that before any of the food goes to any church or shelter I will state that this is where the money has come from and the reasoning behind it, i will then ask them if they would be willing to accept the food on behalf of the LGBTQ community. This project will help to break negative ideas that people have about the LGBTQ community and it will shed light on the things that people have said because of a picture on Facebook.

What We Need

I'm asking for $2000 because I want this to be a sizable contribution from one group of people that are made to feel like second class citizens to another. We will be buying products from all of the brands listed here;http://snacks.kraftfoodscompany.com/Brands/larg...

The shelters that will be receiving the food are going to be located in Columbus Ohio and surrounding suburbs and communities. no matter the amount of money we make together I will make sure that people are able to enjoy a meal because of your contribution and I’ll also make sure they know who it came from.

The Difference We Can Make 

This is an opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives by showing that you support the LGBTQ community and more directly by helping to feed the homeless. Together we can show people that love is a stronger force than hate by helping these people with a meal for a day maybe more. Ignorance does not have to breed more ignorance.

 

Here Is another Way You Can Help 

If there is no way that you can help out financially just go out and tell people about this tell them what we're trying to do here that we want to help people understand that being a homosexual isn't a negative in life. if you have some spare time go to a homeless person give them a package of Oreos and tell them the story of why you're doing this explain to them that the food you just gave them is from someone that whole heartedly supports the LGBTQ community. 

If you like this idea please help me spread the word, the more people that know means more Oreos for the homeless!!
story_txt:
Oreos to Fight Intolerance 
My name is Joe Gibson I am a married father of two. I have been through stretches of homelessness in my life and I also identify as a bisexual person. I feel that any donations for any reason are welcome to people in that situation. This is an important cause because with this we can do a little good in the world and also show people that someone isn't a bad person because their lifestyle is different from theirs. I have many friends who are part of the LGBTQ community and the reaction that we all saw from people on Facebook earlier today was awful and insulting. I also promise that before any of the food goes to any church or shelter I will state that this is where the money has come from and the reasoning behind it, i will then ask them if they would be willing to accept the food on behalf of the LGBTQ community. This project will help to break negative ideas that people have about the LGBTQ community and it will shed light on the things that people have said because of a picture on Facebook.

What We Need
I'm asking for $2000 because I want this to be a sizable contribution from one group of people that are made to feel like second class citizens to another. We will be buying products from all of the brands listed here;http://snacks.kraftfoodscompany.com/Brands/larg...
The shelters that will be receiving the food are going to be located in Columbus Ohio and surrounding suburbs and communities. no matter the amount of money we make together I will make sure that people are able to enjoy a meal because of your contribution and I’ll also make sure they know who it came from.

The Difference We Can Make 
This is an opportunity to make a difference in people’s lives by showing that you support the LGBTQ community and more directly by helping to feed the homeless. Together we can show people that love is a stronger force than hate by helping these people with a meal for a day maybe more. Ignorance does not have to breed more ignorance.
 
Here Is another Way You Can Help 
If there is no way that you can help out financially just go out and tell people about this tell them what we're trying to do here that we want to help people understand that being a homosexual isn't a negative in life. if you have some spare time go to a homeless person give them a package of Oreos and tell them the story of why you're doing this explain to them that the food you just gave them is from someone that whole heartedly supports the LGBTQ community. 
If you like this idea please help me spread the word, the more people that know means more Oreos for the homeless!!

story:
The LifeSoap Story

LifeSoap has been featured in:

 

LifeSoap is a groundbreaking subscription soap service for health conscious people across the US. Our service allows amazing customers to get all the soap they need and bring clean water to children around the world each month without ever leaving home.

Our soaps are made from USDA certfied organic ingredients and work great for people with sensitive skin.

Please click here to learn more about our soaps! 

"LifeSoap is a unique idea, a phenomenal concept with a product that makes your body smooth and simultaneously helps others across the globe." -Juliana

 

We are a for-profit company that gives 10% of each purchase to bring clean water and a brighter future to children in need around the world. 

LifeSoap Company was founded by college roommates Aaron Madonna and Juwon Melvin. 

Somewhere between swapping travel stories over coffee, the idea for LifeSoap was born: Let’s start a little company and sell organic soap that caters to people who have sensitive skin. Better yet, let’s give a portion of each purchase to help kids in developing countries receive clean water, better health, and a brighter future!

In just 18 months we’ve made great progress. We’ve funded projects at two schools in Nicaragua--bringing clean water to 600 students. We've been featured in Oprah Magazine and other national media. And we’ve developed an amazing community of customers from across the United States. This is only the beginning…

The more LifeSoap grows to more children we can help around the world. Our business model allows us to give in a sustainable way by giving 10% of each month’s sales to support clean water projects. We have a great product and a great cause but we do not have a huge marketing budget like the big guys. We need additional resources to invest in marketing and get the word out to more people. We have built this company with our own cash and with the support of amazing family & friends. We need your help to impact more lives.

What are we going to do with the money?

We are asking for $10,000 to invest into marketing. We need to get the word out to more people, increase our amazing customer community, so together we can bring clean water to thousands of children in need around the world.

With a base of 1,000 subscribers we will be able to fund up to 4 clean water projects per year in Central America and Africa. This will allow us to bring clean water and a brighter future to over 1,200 children in need each year!

The impact

 

Our giving partners include H2O For Life and El Porvenir. Both organizations are highly respected in the international non-profit sector.

Perk levels

We will ship your gift on December 17, 2012 

Update!! Launching Water Walks for Kids:

Today (11/13/12) marks the beginning of our Water Walk for Kids series. Over the next 6 days Aaron and I will walk anywhere from 2-6 miles each day, carrying 6 gallon water containers. These walks are designed to simulate the experiences of countless children around the world who are forced to miss school as they collect water for their families.

Please click on the image above to see the video announcing the launch of the campaign and continue to check back here for more updates and photos!! Please share with family and friends! 

Other ways you can help

If you cannot give a financial contribution you can still make a difference. Help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends & family. Please help us spread the word on Facebook and Twitter using the share tools at the top of the page (under the intro video). We appreciate your support! Please let me know if there is anything I can do for you. You can email me any time at aaron@lifesoapcompany.com

Thank you for making a difference!

Aaron Madonna & Juwon Melvin

LifeSoap Company

story:
5 people from around the world join together on a road trip across the country to spread kindness everywhere they go...

Our Vision:During the month of January 2014 of a crew of 5, some strangers and friends, will jump in an RV and travel across the country from Los Angeles, California to Tampa, Florida stopping in various cities across the country to give back in miraculous ways along the journey. While documenting our adventure on the road and going into some of the toughest parts of town to give back, we will unite others to help feed the hunger, provide warmth to the cold, be a friend to those in need, and spread happiness where there is sadness. 

Our Background & Experience:

Kindness Loves Company is a Live it Give it Experience. Live it Give it is our non-profit organization which focuses on serving communities around the world to live a better life and then pay if forward. In the past, we've helped build schools in Guatamala, spread holiday cheer to children in Ecuador. This year we are focusing on giving back in even more tremendous ways this year in the United States. In December, we will sponsor students to join us in discovering the world via a 16 days, 7 country cruise through Central and South America. Immediately following this life-changing voyage, we jump in the RV and prepare to spread tons of love, kindness, and service across the country. With your help, we'll be able to make an incredible impact on thousands of lives this January 2014. 

The Future We Are Creating:

Studies show that generousity is infectious and the power of kindness truly has a ripplling effect on us all. So our goal is to intensify the effects of paying it forward tremdenously. We are creating a future which seeks to find creative and meaningful ways to give back in any way, or anywhere, possible. The future we create will look forward to expanding their horizons, travel the world, learn about other cultures, and strive to truly make the world a better place by being the absolute most positive change in the world. 

Tipping Point Goal: $3,800

Total Funding Goal: $15,000

Our tipping point is set at $3,800 to cover the bare minimum cost to rent the RV which we serve as our home on wheels to venture across the country spreading kindness.

Once we hit $5,000 we will be able to cover the cost of fuel so we can actually make it across the entire country!

Reaching $10,000 would rock our socks off as it would allow us to cover the cost of providing meals for the hungry, school supplies for children in need, blankets for homeless during these cold winter months.

The ultimate goal of $15,000 will help us achieve the ability to provide an abundance of kindness, resources and service and have an even greater impact on impoverished communities. We would help an even greater number of children, families and adults.

The funds will be used in a variety of ways. Here are a few of the ways... 

Donate a blanket to someone out in the cold

Feed the hungry on the streets and in shelters

Buy school supplies for children in need

Donate food for food drives

Give toys & clothes to foster homes

Donate clothes and supplies for woman shelters

Random acts of kindness

Help Keep Us Fueled 

Help Fund the Kindness Loves Company RV 

and many other creative and meaningful ways that we find along the journey! 

*All donations will go towards making this trip happen and helping us make the biggest impact in each city we visit.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Bad Wolf, and this is my dream.

Nearly four years ago, I stepped out onto the roller rink, wobbly kneed but grinning. This was the start of something great, I could tell. I hadn't been on roller skates in 20 years, but I absolutely loved it. The athleticism, the power, the badassery... going from a lifelong booknerd and self-proclaimed anti-athlete, this particular sport got under my skin and burrowed its way into my brain.

And now, this business has also burrowed its way in. It competes for space in my head, with other thoughts like "taking care of my family" and "maintaining good work ethic". This shop has become my heart and soul. I spend every waking moment, and most of my sleeping moments, thinking about it.  I have wanted my own business since I was a teenager, and all my years of working retail and customer service jobs has prepped me for this moment. All these years, I believed that I wasn't smart enough or ambitious enough to do it. I've endured countless whispers of "you won't make any money." or "you know it would just fail, right?" and it's kept me from following my dream.

Until now.

I'm determined to make this a reality. I refuse to let it fail. I refuse to listen to those old voices in my head telling me I can't. When I first skittered out onto the rink, my skates slid around wildly in what I call my "Bambi On Ice Moment." It took months of hard work to overcome that. And now I'm back there again, in a different way. My knees are wobbly, I don't really know what I'm doing, but I know I have a fire in my heart and I won't let that burn out, just like I didn't let my derby fire burn out.


What We Need & What You Get

Starting a new business takes dedication, smarts, tenacity, and above all MONEY. It will take at least two grand to just open my doors. There are first and last month's rent charges, inventory to order, and advertising costs, as well as costs to file the name with the state and get a website going.

The Impact

There are currently 5 roller derby leagues in Portland and Vancouver, one in Salem, and two in Bend. 4 of those leagues have popped up in the last two years. Portland is becoming saturated with roller derby skaters and currently has no way to support needs. The options of ordering online or purchasing at a pro-shop in a skating rink are all severely limited. I plan to be the go to place for people who play all the different types of roller sports to make it easier and more fun to shop for gear. I will be open 6 days a week as well as online ordering options, and will be in a convenient location so you will always have an easy way to replace that missing mouth guard, or broken knee pad, or buy your first pair of skates.  If I don't get money in savings, I will still be able to get financed most likely, but that is not a route I want to take and it would mean less inventory and less capitol to work with. If I manage to raise more than the $2000 I plan to invest it into the business and ultimately won't have to borrow as much.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate anything you feel comfortable with, even $5 will get me closer to opening my doors. If you can't possibly donate money, that's ok!! Please help me by spreading the word about my campaign. Tell your friends on facebook, tell your derby team mates and coaches that the coolest new skate shop is close to opening it's doors!

story:
Who We Are

My name is Heidi Liedeker and I am the owner of Meat for cats and dogs. Meat is a pet supply store that specializes in raw food and holistic diets for cats and dogs. Since opening in 2005, Meat has grown to become a hub for pet lovers, with a dedicated staff that is happy to answer questions about diet and nutrition for pets.

Meat outgrew its original home in 2008, and now we must expand again in order to meet our customers' needs. Our new home was purchased on October 29th, 2013, and we are only a short gap in funding away from being ready to move. That's where this indiegogo campaign comes in.

How Our Store Will Grow

Meat's Current Home

  • 6-door walk-in freezer
  • 1 register
  • 1500 sqft
  • no separate entrance for deliveries

Meat's New Home

  • 16-door walk-in freezer
  • 2 registers
  • 3000 sqft
  • dedicated delivery door with backroom

The Perks

Meat's success would not be possible without the help of our friends, our customers, and an amazing staff. All of our perks are named after the pets of Meat's crew, since they test all of our food and toys.

We sincerely appreciate your support! Your name will be added to a contributors page of our website.

The Tofu, plus you'll receive a Meat t-shirt in your choice of size. We'll ship our newest white-on-gray design, or you may come into our store and pick from any of our older stock.

The Tofu, plus a Meat hoodie for you or your dog, in your choice of size.

The Dagger (t-shirt and your name on our website), plus the name of you or your pet will be added to our Meat Lovers Wall.

The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus each month for a year, you'll receive a cat treat or cat toy as chosen by the Meat staff and their cats. You may choose to pick these up at our store or have them shipped to you.

The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus each month for a year, you and your dog may come to Meat and choose one pound of bulk dog biscuits. (This perk cannot be shipped.)

The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus we'll host a birthday party for your dog at Meat. Invite up to 5 dog friends and their people. We'll supply the space, goodie bags, cupcakes for dogs and people, and plenty of water and beer. 2-hour limit.


The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus a dog birthday party to go.  We will give you cupcakes for 6 dogs and 6 people (gluten free and vegan available), a six pack of beer and goodie bags for 6 dogs.  You supply the space, the water and can take as much time as you want.


The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), your pet's image will be featured in a mural, painted by Portland's own Chris Haberman, at the new space. Be sure to send us a favorite photo of your pet for reference.

              

The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus we will dedicate one of the 16 doors of our new walk-in freezer to you and your pet. Your name, your pet's name, and a 8"x8" hand drawn charcoal portrait of your pet will be displayed above one of our walk-in freezer doors for all to see. Portraits to be drawn by the talented Portland artist, Amy Lousie.

                                           

                                     

The Maggie (Meat Lovers Wall, t-shirt, and your name on our website), plus our friends at Coalition Brewing Co. are willing to help you brag on your pet by naming a beer after them. They will host a release party for your beer, where you get to drink for free.  You will take home a full growler and 4 t-shirts incorporating your pet's photo in the label design. 

Stretch Goals

if we reach $70,000 every person who contributed will get a free Meat drink koozie sent to your house or to be picked up at the shop

if we reach $90,000 every contributor at the Piper or Dutch level and above will receive a pair of Meat underwear in your size sent to your house or picked up at the shop

       

About Me

I'm a Portland native who has witnessed, first-hand, the benefits of a raw food diet. Chevy, my Rottweiler/ Shepherd mix, suffered from many diet-based ailments until we switched to a raw diet. My goal with Meat was to create a space where raw food feeders could find all of their supplies, ask questions, and share their experiences.  I sought to make raw food diets for pets as easy and affordable as possible.  

Meat has been open for 9 years and has grown bigger than I ever imagined. We focus on raw food and also offer an array of natural, holistic dry and canned food choices. 

How You Can Help

Thank you for supporting Meat for cats and dogs and for helping us to finish our new home.  Any contribution is very appreciated.  For this campaign to succeed we need to get the word out to as many people as possible, so please share this link however you can.

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Meat-for-Cats-and-Dogs/301482223297980

My goal with Meat was to create a space where raw food feeders could find all of their supplies, ask questions, and share their experiences.  I sought to make raw food diets for pets as easy and affordable as possible.  Meat has been open for 9 years and has grown bigger than I ever imagined. We focus on raw food and also offer an array of natural, holistic dry and canned food choices. How You Can HelpThank you for supporting Meat for cats and dogs and for helping us to finish our new home.  Any contribution is very appreciated.  For this campaign to succeed we need to get the word out to as many people as possible, so please share this link however you can.Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Meat-for-Cats-and-Dogs/301482223297980

story:
Help teens in Guatemala City score against violence

La Media Cancha brings sports and values based education to socially excluded communities in Guatemala City.

Guatemala City is the 14th most dangerous city in the world and the 5th in number of violent murders. Domestic violence, alcholism, and drug addition add to a weak local economy in creating the issues that children and teens from El Amparo and Nuevo Amanecer, the two comunities where we work, face every day.

La Media Cancha project was created to prevent violence in these communities and provide children and teens with another option: sport and the opportunity to belong to a safe, supportive and healthy group.

The project provides soccer training while promoting values and support through collaborative games.

The start of La Media Cancha

One year ago, Diego González, a Guatemalan student of psychology, decided to start La Media Cancha Project to support children and teens living in excluded communities throughout Guatemala City.

He started talking with the neighbors of various communities and he found an existing soccer school started by Hedgar in the community Amparo. Hedgar told Diego about the need of a program like La Media Cancha in the community close by, Nuevo Amanecer. Since then they have been working with the children in both communities.

Meet Axel, one of La Media Cancha`s local stars

My name is Axel, I am ten year old and I live in El Amparo, a community in Guatemala City. Daily life here is quite hard. Most of my friends don’t go to school because they work in order to help support their families while others fall into drug addiction (they sniff glue) or get involved with “maras” or “pandillas juveniles” (gangs) operating in the community. La Media Cancha has given me the opportunite to meet friends and spent the afternoon having fun instead of being in the street surrounded by problems, violence, and drugs.

Sport, Education, and Values

The goal of the La Media Cancha project is to contribute to the development of children from El Amparo and Nuevo Amanecer through soccer and the values associated with the sport such as team work, camaraderie, leadership, entrepreneurship, self-esteem, and respect. Children are provided with another avenue in life which helps prevent joining gangs and offers the support they need.

When the children arrive to the soccer field, they first have a space where they can talk and share their day-to-day worries, then they play collaborative games, receive tactical, technical, and physical training and finish the day with a soccer match.

Achievements

Since 2013, La Media Cancha has managed to positively impact approximately 40 children in El Amparo and Nuevo Amanecer communities. Moreover, neighborhood committees and parents are becoming involved in the project, helping us grow our impact. 


What is next?

We have a list of goals for 2015.  We know that with your support and our work we will make this “wish” list become a “done” list by the end of next year.

The funding objective of $3,000 will allow La Media Cancha to expand to other communities and better equip the current project.

We will use the money to:

•  Buy materials such as balls and cones. Right now we attend 40 children with only three balls.

•  Many of our children come to the training without having eaten a proper meal during the day. We will offer them an energetic and healthy snack during the training session.

·  Next year we will join a tournament to give the children the opportunity to see beyond their neighborhoods, we will need to pay the inscription and get uniforms for them.

·  We will expand the program to other communities.

Spread the Word!!

Wheether you are able to contribute to our campaign or not, you can still share our project and help us get the word out there. Tell your friends about La Media Cancha, here are the links to our facebook and website. 

Facebook

Website

Las fotos y el video ha sido tomadas por Julie Dalsgaard Knudsen

story:
You’re just one person, there’s not much you can do in the global face of things, right? Well, no. United for Hope started with one passionate person putting everything she has into changing the lives of rural Indians. Join her, join us, in doing a little to make a big change.

Photo above: Tara McCartney and the children from Tirmasahun

We’d argue that making a small donation here, now, joining us at the beginning of our incredible journey, could be the most worthwhile and impactful thing you’ll ever do.


The world is imbalanced. Around the globe, there are huge disparities across food and nutrition, clean water and good sanitation, health and education: the things that many of us take for granted are often out of reach in places like rural India. 

All are the building blocks of family and community. They are our sustenance and our springboards to being our best selves. 

All we’re doing here at United for Hope is redressing the balance. 

It is a big challenge, but one that we can overcome if we work together.



In the last 12 months, United for Hope has built sustainable toilets for 50 families. This year, we’ll make sure the whole village has access to a toilet. We installed solar lamps along the main street to make a safer environment and gave many families solar lights – a much safer alternative to kerosene lamps. We recruited 2 additional teachers, plastered and painted classrooms and provided functioning toilets for 400 children. 

Photo above: one of the many families who now have their own toilet.

We have also drilled for water, boring 120ft to find a clean, sustainable source for the entire community.

And we have done all of this in full consultation with the community, encouraging villagers to take ownership of decision-making and contributing financially. 

You could say it’s been an education. Which is why we’re now focused on building a community centre that will really revolutionise the future of Tirmasahun.

We’ve done all this in our first year, with little funds, a collaborative approach, a committed leadership and a small army of professional volunteers across Europe and India.

 

Photo: Global Handwashing Day


The Community Centre and all associated development work will be the first of many projects across rural India, providing the blueprint that will break the cycle of poverty and educate children and adults to dare to dream of a better life.

And in that context, we’ll continue to manage a project of works that aims to meet the wide variety of needs that come with holistic development. And we are succeeding. 

We’re emboldened by what we’ve achieved to date and we won’t stop until we do much, much more. We’re realising that the more we do, the more we can do and we’re making great strides - often with very little financial input.

What we do really well is making a small amount of money go further to make the biggest impact.

So you can be confident your contribution, however small, will make a huge difference. 

​The project will be carried out between March and September 2015.

The new Learning and Resource Centre will offer: 

• After school tuition program 
• English & computer lessons for children 
• Women’s health, hygiene & empowerment classes 
• Drop in centre for government-related issues and programs 
• Community meeting point
• Teacher training programs 
• Adult vocational and educational training 

Photo Above: Architectural plans of our community center 

Our Centre will be at the heart of a strong community: a place to host community events, a citizen's advice centre, health clinics and much more.
The Centre will have a deep water well on-site and be independent from the unreliable electricity grid via its own solar-powered energy system.

 

The total cost of work is 50,000 Euros.

With fundraising, we’ve secured the first 10,000 Euros toward construction and hope to raise 10,000 more

The additional 30,000 Euros will be crowdfunded in two phases:

Reaching our goal of 15,000 Euros will allow us to cover the most essential costs of the project, to include: 

•         Leveling the ground, and creating solid foundations

•         Basic construction of a two-story building including supplies and labour

The final goal of 15,000 Euros will allow us to:

•​Finish building, including fixtures and fitting

•          Sanitation facilities for students and guests

Photo above: The wall for the community center has already begun.


Tara McCartney is an Irish girl living in Germany whose heart belongs to India.  Just over one year ago, she decided to ditch her comfortable corporate job to put her skills and knowledge to much better use. Like many people, she knows firsthand the issues people in rural India face. Unlike many people, she can see what she can do about it. Tara is a hands on person who refuses to take no for an answer. Where other people see problems first and get lost in the endless debate on the pros and cons, Tara gets stuck in and gets things done. She has inspired an ever growing team of volunteers to contribute whatever they can and continues to work doggedly on the ground to overcome entrenched views and encourage collaboration - the vital key to making progress efficiently and effectively. 

Tara and the team have already achieved so much, you can be assured that your contribution will be put to good use where it is needed most.  

You can find out more about United for Hope, achievements so far and our incredible ambitions at www.unitedforhope.org

story:
SparkMacon is a community innovation space equipped with the tools, equipment, and grass-roots education required to convert your idea into a reality.  Think of it as a gym membership to exercise your creativity, hands and brain.  Our community will serve artisans, technology creatives, and creative tinkers with access to tools and equipment, training, and support for entrepreneurs.  In our vision, the space will be equipped with a wood / metal working shop, electronic lab tools and supplies, a laser cutter, engraver, music recording lab, and a professional grade 3D printer giving Macon makers access to tools that would be cost prohibitive to own yourself.  Join the Spark Macon project: the movement to build the community and space for grass-roots innovation and art in Macon, GA.  Together, we will blend the best of art and technology innovation.

Learn more at http://SparkMacon.com

Why should you care?

We believe that supporting creativity and connection between the arts and technology is how we bring the next great ideas to life :
Who are we?
 
  • A group of  government, business and community leaders spent almost 9 months exploring the idea of  putting a MakerSpace in Macon.  From that larger group the small group of "Founders" you see in our team section took the project on.  These "Founders" represent many aspects of our community and the desire to bring together and create.
Why are we doing this?
  • Part of receiving the full amount from our initial seed grant requires us to be able to show community support through this crowdfunding campaign. We also know that without your support this project will be short lived.  We need members and community support from the start to succeed and that is where you come in.
What does your support mean to us?
  • With your support we hope to provide a home for the next generation of inventors and creators; support creative hobbies, and provide the resources for those individuals who are ready to create now.


What We Need & What You Get

We want everything we do with SparkMacon to be a two way street.  We want members to both give and get from this effort and so should anyone willing to help fund the space.  So here are some background on what we need and what we plan to provide:

  • The space we secured had an issue around providing ADA access.  The landlord graciously agreed to install a lift for us.  This did require us to provide for a long term lease where if we don't complete the lease a portion of the lift cost will have to be covered.  Funds from this campaign will in part go to cover this cost so we will not have this long term risk.
  • While the initial grant will provide for many of the initial tools and resources the space will need, there are many that it won't.  Funds from this campaign will go toward expanding our offering to address more needs that the community has outlined in our initial research.
  • We hope we have provided perks at all levels for all people no matter their interest.  But some of the cool ones are discounted members, Workshop Attendance, T-Shirts, and Invitations to our Grand Opening and Donor Dinner.  Not to mention inclusion on our donor walls inside the space.
What are the workshops you ask?  
First we plan to hold workshops around 3D printing, laser engraving, woodworking, graphic design, robotics and others that will cover tools and resources inside the space.  
But even more special is access to specially arranged workshops from the Macon Arts Alliance Amplify program.  These workshops will include topics around marketing, social media, business planning, funding, online business and others.

The Impact

Fostering a Maker City: Why should Silicon Valley have all the fun?  We believe that Middle Georgia has the vision and talent to become a center of excellence in art and technology.  We look forward to the day that members of our SparkMacon community assume leadership roles in our local economy and start new small businesses.  Our SparkMacon community will provide the equipment, tools, and grass-roots training that you need to convert your idea into a reality.  SparkMacon will provide hands-on learning opportunities in 3D modeling, marketing, arts, shop skills, running your business, and training for the tools in the space.  We believe that our space will help attract top technology talent to Macon, GA.  Many of these classes and meet-ups will be led by SparkMacon community members.

Young Makers Program: At SparkMacon, we believe it’s important to help our students be prepared for the economy of the future.  This economy will demand that our citizens be innovative, creative and use technology effectively.  In our young makers program, we will challenge students to envision and design their own projects.  It could be a game, a toy, a mobile app, art, a website or anything they can imagine.  Our maker mentors will support the students with coaching, tools training, and resources to help them bring their designs to life in a project based learning experience.   We hope to inspire the next generation of makers to love learning and help them be creative and curious.

Growing the Creative Economy: Creativity is contagious.  In the SparkMacon community, we encourage artists and artisans to support each other in their crafts.  We believe that cross-discipline sharing between artists and technologists will inspire a bold movement of innovation in Macon.  Funding and marketing are top concerns to all artists, technology makers, and business owners.  Our community will need to grow a culture of leadership and entrepreneurship through education and social meet-ups.  All great ideas are the result of extensive focus, ideation, prototyping, measurement and learning from wins and failures.  Our space will provide the culture, space, and tools so that you can build, measure, and learn quickly.

Risks & Challenges

Since this effort is being done as a not-for-profit and for the community good, it is being run with very little room for operating below breakeven.  Our biggest risk is a lack of interest from makers to become members or support from the community, which would result in a lack of funding to sustain the space.

  • We have a small portion of our initial grant funding to use for operating expenses which should allow us enough time to reach sustainability.  The founding team spent time at other MakerSpaces and did financial reviews of this effort to ensure we understood our membership numbers.
  • Our membership numbers that we need are 80 standard members based on expected expenses, but with support from the community that number could be less.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute financially to the effort and that is OK.  If you are interested in contributing in a non-monetary way please consider:

  • Post on any social media site you are part of about the space and this effort.  The more people talking about it the better.
  • Tell a friend who might be interested in becoming a member or contributing about the space and the effort.  Tell them why you feel the space and effort is important.
  • Attend any of the community events we are hosting to show support.  We can use hands too!

story:
Jardin d'Eden Jamaica


La version française suivra

       A dream ...

We want to create a site where people can relax under the tropical sun, away from the city, in a natural environment surrounded by greenery.

My name is Melissa Dauphin Johnson, I am married to Howard Johnson, an exceptional man who is also a  reggae singer who goes by  the name of King Shadrock. We have 2 wonderful children, one age 11 and the last 6 years which bite into our daily lives. My family and I lived in Montreal, where I was the community youth worker teenagers, my job was to develop these youth empowerment, self-esteem and promote their reintegration.

Despite the career of King Shadrock going well and the children were doing great in school, it seems that we were missing something. After several trips to Jamaica, Howard and I were considering seriously the possibility to move to Jamaica to live other experiences. That's what we did one month after our last trip.

Arrived on the island, we settled. My children and I discovered and adaptations to another culture and Howard rediscovered his country he left 19 years. We rented a house on a beautiful grounds in the district of Eden where we received many guests from abroad. The latter, loved and appreciate our services. They also liked to live near people of the region and to be part of the community. Another advantage was that during outings, guests can take advantage of discounts that we  could offer them as we are now citizens. All these good vibrations shared by our guests, so we had  to give the idea to benefit more people, but how? After 1 year and a half, we received an offer to purchase piece of land on the  mountain  we accept immediately. Definitely, Jamaica seemed to offer us much more.

We bought the land and started the cleaning work. During the work, we have realized that for a project of this scale, we needed help. It is for this reason that we start this finance campaign. 

Contribute to this project will enable more people to enjoy this site.

It will also allow us to create jobs for the citizens of the surrounding neighborhoods, especially young people.

Have a small but growing business that will allow us to carry out several other projects.      


What We Need 

We need for our project,  a minimum of $ 20,000 CAD for continuity.

 The money raised will:

- Pay construction materials and transportation.

- Pay people that collect recyclable materials and transportation.

- Pay workers (carpenter, bricklayer, plumber, electrician, workers).

-  purchase of food for the volunteers.


The Impact on the community

The realization of this project will engage young people in this district. These young people are already investing their free time because they believe in the project.

By contributing to this project, you not only help the  youth in the community to grow with an aid . You also permit the world to a unique experience.


Challenges 

Lack of money could be crucial for our project. The temperature can play an important role.  without funding, we will still make this project but over a longer period.


Other Ways You Can Help 

There are many ways to help.

You can talk about the project to the people around you, Share the link using the tools Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, email and more. You can also visit us and participate.


Thank you very much


Version française

  Un rêve...

Nous souhaitons créer un site où les gens peuvent se ressourcer sous le soleil des tropiques, loin de la ville, dans une ambiance naturelle et entourer de verdure.

Je me nomme Mélissa Dauphin Johnson, je suis mariée à Howard Johnson, un homme exceptionel qui est également un chanteur de reggae, il se produit sous le nom de King Shadrock. Nous avons 2 merveilleux enfants, une de 11 ans et le dernier de 6 ans qui mordent dans la vie quotidiennement. Ma famille et moi vivions à Montréal où j'occupais le poste de travailleuse communautaire auprès des jeunes adolescentes, mon emploi consistait à developper chez ces jeunes l'empowerment, leur estime de soi et de favoriser leur réinsertion sociale. 

Malgré la carrière de King Shadrock en plein envol et les performances  de nos enfants à l'école, il semble qu'il nous manquait quelque chose. Après plusieurs voyages en Jamaique, Howard et moi envisagions sérieusement la possibilité de s'y s'installer pour vivre d'autres expériences. Ce que nous avons fait 1 mois après notre dernier voyage. 

Arrivé-es sur les lieux, nous nous sommes installé-es. Mes enfants et moi découvrions et s'adaptions à une autre culture et Howard redécouvrait son pays qu'il avait quitté depuis 19 ans. Nous avons loué une maison sur un magnifique terrain dans le district d'Eden où nous recevions plusieurs invités de l'étranger. Ces derniers, raffolaient du site et adoraient nos services. Ils aimaient également vivre près des habitants de la région et de faire partie de la communauté. Un autre avantage était que lors des sorties, nos invités pouvaient profiter des rabais qu'on pouvait leur offrir puisque nous étions maintenant citoyens. Toutes ces bonnes vibrations partagées par nos invités, nous ont donc donner l'idée d'en faire profiter plus de monde, mais comment? Après 1 an et demi, nous recevions une offre d'achat sur un terrain en montagne toujours à Eden que nous acceptions immédiatement. Décidement, la Jamaique semblait vouloir nous en offrir beaucoup plus. 

Nous avons donc acheté le terrain et avons commencé à le nettoyer. Durant les travaux, nous nous sommes rendus compte que pour un projet de cette envergure, il nous fallait  de l'aide. C'est pour cette raison que nous partons cette campagne de financement. 

Contribuer à ce projet, permettra à un plus grand nombre de visiteurs de profiter de ce site.

Le projet nous permettra également de créer de l'emploi pour les citoyens du quartiers et des environs, principalement les jeunes.

Avoir une petite business grandissante qui nous permettra de réaliser plusieurs autres projets.


Ce que nous avons besoin

Pour la réalisation de notre projet, nous avons besoin d'un minimum de 20 000$ CAD. 

L'argent récolté cela servira: 

- Payer les matériaux de construction et leur transport.

- Payer les gens qui récupèrent les matériaux recyclés et leur transport.

- Payer les travailleurs (charpentier, maçon, plombier, électricien, les travailleurs).

- Payer l'achat des aliments pour nourrir les volontaires.


L'impact sur la communauté

La réalisation de ce projet permettra d'engager un bon pourcentage  de jeunes de ce district. Ces jeunes investissent déjà leur temps gratuitement puisqu'ils croient au projet.

En contribuant à ce projet, vous contribuerez au bon développement du quartier, de sa jeunesse. Vous permettrez également  au monde entier la possibilité de vivre une expérience unique. 


Défis

Le manque d'argent qui pourrait être cruciale pour notre projet. La température peut jouer un rôle important.  Par contre sans le financement, nous allons tout de même réaliser ce projet mais sur une plus longue période.


Un autre moyen de nous aider


Vous pouvez parler du projet aux personnes autour de vous, partager le lien en utilisant les outils IndieGoGo, Facebook, Twitter, email et plus. Vous pouvez également nous rendre visite et participer.


Merci infiniment

story:
Our Goal

With this campaign, we are asking you to help us bring Bitcoin into the mainstream by contributing to get our commercial to air on national TV during this year's Bitcoin Bowl, on ESPN, December 26.


Who We Are

Love Will Inc., is a self-funded software development company based in Lexington, Kentucky. Our flagship product, Pheeva, was the first Bitcoin wallet released on the App Store, and is now available for Android and Google Chrome Browser. At Love Will we want to make Bitcoin easy for everyone and designed our wallet to be "so simple even Grandma can use it."

We are a young group that is passionate about Bitcoin and want to share the technology with as many people as possible. Our first commercial, released this summer, has received incredible feedback from the Bitcoin community and we are now looking to share it with a wider audience. The Bitcoin Bowl is the industry's first big push into the American mainstream and presents a great opportunity for Bitcoin to leave a positive impression on a national audience. We believe that there should be quality Bitcoin specific advertising to complement the game and this moment.  Help us put Bitcoin on national TV in front of an estimated 2 million+ viewers, during this year's Bitcoin Bowl.


What We Need and What You Get


What we need:

$45,000 by December 1, 2014 to secure an advertising spot with ESPN during the Bitcoin Bowl

  • This will ensure that the commercial airs four times during the broadcast, as well as during any future repeat showings of the game.

100% of contributions will go directly to securing the advertising slot with ESPN. 




You can contribute bitcoins to the campaign by clicking the button above, and you will receive an email receipt confirming your contribution. All Bitcoin contributions will be converted into USD daily through BitPay, and contributed to the Indiegogo campaign. If we do not reach our funding goal, all Bitcoin contributions will be distributed back to the public address we received them from. If you're sending from an HD wallet, please send us an email.

What you get:

By contributing to this campaign you will play a key role in bringing Bitcoin to the masses on a national scale. Bitcoin has and will always be all about community participation, and this effort is no different. Let's all help bring Bitcoin into the spotlight on the national stage.


Consider this

Recently social tipping has exploded through outlets such as Reddit, Twitter, and Youtube, and many users see this as a great way to increase exposure to and adoption of Bitcoin. Users donate about $1, and on average, these tips are collected by only 20% of new users. These numbers indicate that the cost of one new user (who may not even purchase more bitcoin) is $5, and the effectiveness of this method is unpredictable. Bitcoin exchanges have been giving out $10 for “new” user acquisition, with no specific knowledge about these users. With a national Bitcoin commercial, the community can reach just as many new, potential Bitcoiners, at a much lower cost to everyone. For example, if nine thousand members of the Bitcoin community contributed $5 each to this campaign, (the same cost to acquire one new member through social tipping), we could successfully fund the commercial and reach over TWO MILLION people. At just over 2 Cents per person, this is one of the most cost effective ways to reach new users and breaks the pattern of internet only Bitcoin advertising. Even if one 1 in 100 viewers look up Bitcoin, it is still one of the most cost effective means of reaching new eyes. The time is now, help us bring Bitcoin to the national stage.


Why Us?  

The task of "bringing Bitcoin into the mainstream", is not something that we take lightly. This is a technology and an industry that we are extremely passionate about, and we believe that we have the best interests of the community in mind as we pursue this goal of bringing Bitcoin to the national stage. With that said here is a little more about us for those who are not familiar with Pheeva:

In less than a year, Pheeva has grown into one of the most recognizable brands in Bitcoin. Our wallet has received high praise from new users and experts alike as one of the best, most intuitive wallets in the space. Our Coin!D system makes sending Bitcoin as easy as sending a text or an email, and through our integration with Gyft, users can seamlessly buy digital gift cards to over 200 brands, directly in their wallet.  We believe strongly in empowering true individual ownership of funds, and thus do not hold any users’ private keys. In addition to ease of use, our simple interface is complimented by a robust backend to provide a world-class user experience, security, and reliability.

We created the Jacket Wallet for Georgia Tech: the first custom wallet for an American university, and have partnered with BitPay and the College Cryptocurrency Network to scale this model to other universities across the country and abroad. BitPay is sponsoring the Bitcoin Bowl, and will be assisting us in promoting this campaign to the Bitcoin community and beyond.


How we'll get the Word Out

We will be blasting this campaign across social media outlets with the help of our friends in the Bitcoin community, but we can not bring Bitcoin into the national spotlight without your help. As a self-funded, bootstrapped startup, we understand that not everyone can make a donation, but if you support what we're trying to do please share our campaign through Reddit, Facebook and  Twitter.

This is a great opportunity for the entire industry, let's help Bitcoin break into the national scene and get its first national commercial on ESPN!







Pheeva Contacts:

jeff@pheeva.com

lafe@pheeva.com

casey@pheeva.com

aj@pheeva.com

dave@pheeva.com

lamar@pheeva.com

story:
The Ants Craft is a 7-year old Fair Trade community business that creates livelihoods for 4,000 Northeast Indian artisans. We return profits to the artisan community via higher wages and employing more people.  Most of our artisans are women, and the benefits of empowering women accrue to the whole family. 

We are raising $30,000 to equip a finishing unit in Bangalore to handle large export orders. LArger orders will allow us to provide sustainable employment for 15,000 artisans vs. 4,000.

Here's our story.......

14 years ago, our parent organisation set up the the ant to work on health and education in Northeast India.

The 8 states of Northeast India - Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Meghalaya, Tripura, Sikkim, Mizoram, and Manipur - are beautiful and culturally diverse, but economically impoverished.

In these predominantly rural communities, many families own neither land nor livestock. Men are forced to work as day laborers and women as housemaids. There is little money for education or healthcare. Any unforeseen expense, like a family member's illness, drives the family into debt.

Determined to break this dependence, in 2002 Smitha Murthy, a textile designer and co-founder of The Ants Craft, started working with tribal Bodo women to use their traditional weaving skills. Smitha focused on creating  designs for the urban market, introducing new yarns, colors, and designs.

Realizing that the women needed decision making power and control over their working conditions, we set up Aagor, a weavers' collective managed entirely by women.

Initially we marketed the garments at exhibitions. Seeing that the weavers needed direct market access, in 2007 we opened the Ants Store in Bangalore, India.  And in 2013, we began selling online at The Ants Store.

We have been successful beyond our wildest dreams!  Beginning with a small group of Bodo women weavers of Assam, today we work with 4000 artisans all over the Northeast. 

We design, produce and sell garments, jewellery, baskets, pottery, food and toiletries. All our products are Fair Trade, and our artisans are paid fair wages; no child labor is used. 

    


But we stand at a crossroads today. Our store and online business are both doing well, but to truly grow and benefit more artisans, we have moved from a Trust to a for-profit enterprise with the same social cause.

To grow, we need to efficiently handle the large export orders we are already receiving from Europe and the US. Currently we receive products from the Northeast and outsource their finishing, labelling and packing in Bangalore.  We can be far more efficient if we set up a finishing unit to handle these tasks ourselves. This will cost $30,000.

By handling bigger orders, we can employ more artisans and we expect to benefit as many as 15,000 artisans by 2019, a 300% growth in beneficiaries! We can also employ up to 20 underprivileged people in Bangalore and ensure that our entire supply chain is Fair Trade.

Every artisan we work with has a family. The extra income pays for better food, education and health care. It helps families pay off debts and become proud owners of land and livestock.

Help us make this happen! We ask you to support our dream of sustainable livelihoods that also protect beautiful traditional crafts.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $30,000 to set up our finishing unit in Bangalore, India. Take a look at our pie chart to see what we plan to spend it on.  We need 50% for raw materials and wages for the 20 underprivileged people we will employ in Bangalore; this is the only way we can ensure that we buy enough materials to handle large orders and pay the artisans and our workers on time.  

  • The machinery we plan to install includes professional sewing machines and pressing units. The office equipment comprises of laptops, high resolution printers and scanners for a Design Studio, plus studio tables and chairs for drafting/designing.  And the budget for samples includes trial runs to perfect production.
  • Any amount you choose to support our campaign is greatly appreciated. Funding starts at $1 and goes all the way to $1,000. 

  • Even if we raise less than $30,000, we will still begin our finishing unit on a smaller scale. We will put in fewer tailoring and pressing machines and hire fewer people, and will outsource the rest of the finishing until we raise the remaining money.

  • We have beautiful items available at every level of support. Jewelry boxes, silk stoles, Naga shawls....Take a look at snapshots below and the perk descriptions to see what we offer!


Your Perks

For $25 you receive a beautiful handbound notebook made from valuable reclaimed fabrics.

For $50 you receive a bead jewellery box beautifully decorated with colourful beads, cowrie shells, and semi-precious stones.

For $100 you receive a pair of Naga cushion covers.


For $250 you receive a beautiful rich blue silk scarf. Hand spun and hand woven by Bodo women in Assam.

For $500 you receive a beautiful and warm Pashmina scarf from Kashmir.

For $1000 you receive a traditional hand woven Naga shawl that takes an artisan a month to weave on a loin loom.


The Impact

Your support will allow us to reach 15,000 artisans in all 8 Northeast States by 2019, from the 4,000 we reach today! 

The supplementary income an artisan family can earn is an average of INR 1750 ($30 USD) per month, a 50% increase from their base income of INR 3500 ($60 USD) per month.  

Though these numbers may appear modest, in rural India this pays for significantly better food, education and health care. It helps families pay off debts and become proud owners of land and livestock.

Our work also has other social impacts:

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk we have is that our pipeline of wholesale orders will dry up. Today almost all our orders come from Europe and USA, but we have already begun to work with the Asian and Australian markets to mitigate this risk. We are confident that the finishing unit will help us produce high quality finished products, quick turnarounds on samples, and in fact help us gain business.

In case we do end up with excess capacity in our unit, we plan to run the center as a community center where other non-profits and commercial enterprises in Bangalore can benefit from the finishing services.

We have the confidence that we can execute this and use your money effectively.  After all, we have been doing this since 2000.....working with artisans, building a store, selling online.....now you can help us get to the next level! 


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support us! Even if you can't contribute right now, we would be delighted if you can spread the word about our campaign to your friends, co-workers, and family.  Spread the word via Facebook, Twitter and other social media networks to let the world know about us!
