story:
RipOffReport.com is Suing me for Exposing its Appalling Business Practices

Our Best Chance For Relief?

UPDATE: An anonymous $10,000.00 has been received directly and forwarded to our attorney.

A Message from Common Decency, Inc. founder, Michael Roberts

RipOffReport.com's owner, Ed Magedson, has made a big mistake! The federal law that has protected him from defamation liability in the past does not apply to this new case. WE NEED YOUR HELP! This might be our only chance to save victims of his website for good.

Court Documents can be downloaded at the bottom of this page.

CommonDecencyInc.org vs. RipOffReport.com

[Arizona Case: CV2013-012986]

The Goal: Gain Control of RipOffReport.com and Gag its Owner Ed Magedson

Common Decency, Inc. exists in its present form for one purpose and one purpose only. Our mandate is to bring relief to the 1,000,000+ innocent victims of RipOffReport.com and its owner Ed Magedson by suing him for more money than he has, and then levying ownership of the Ripoffreport.com website domain or to force them to change their business practices.  This can be achieved by a counter claim to the lawsuit he has apparently filed against me in Arizona, although I have not been served and DO NOT acknowledge service.

BUT I CAN NOT CARRY THIS BURDEN ALONE.

We are pooling resources with other victims to create a legal battle chest. You can help by donating to the legal fighting fund, every penny will be directed to the legal battle through our attorney's trust account. Paypal submissions will also be forward entirely to the trust account.

For transparency, a full accounting of every penny received and expended will be published each month (with privileged information redacted). Contributor identities will be redacted to protect them from Ed Magedson's revenge (unless you wish to be identified).

What's in it for Us?

RipOffReport.com agents will probably claim that we will use your donations personally; but not a penny will be diverted from the fight for a Ripoff Report Revolution.

Consider it a Loan, not a Donation:

I'd rather not rely on charity, I am willing to work for the financial support you provide. If you are a victim of Ripoff Report, and if you make a donation, then I will provide investigative or litigation support services for you as payment for your support. I have provided pro bono (free) help for over 180 internet harassment victims in the last four years because they could not afford to pay for services.

Why is this Lawsuit Different?

Unlike other lawsuits, Ed Magedson & his company are not shielded by 47 USC § 230C of the Communications Decency Act

Magedson to Face a Jury?

Magedson has never faced a jury because he settles. We won't settle for less than a revolution. There is a reason why he hasn't faced a jury, they will see right through him, and he knows it!

Help Fund this Fight!

Donate to this legal fund and every penny will be used to save victims of RipOffReport.com.

How are Donations Used?

Donations are used to offset expenses related to attorneys, digital forensics, forensic accountants, private investigators, etc.

What if we Win?

Every dollar donated to the legal fighting fund will be matched dollar for dollar from any judgment we receive to establish a "Common Decency Trust" to help other victims of Internet harassment and defamation.

How Will We End the ROR Reign of Terror?

Ed made a strategic error in registering RipOffReport.com to the same company that injures many good people. We hope to levy ownership of that domain as part of any judgment satisfaction.

What about the Real Scammers?

Ed Magedson has lost all claims to social heroism because he chooses a “we do not remove complaints” policy. Although his site may expose real scammers, the hundreds of thousands of innocent collateral damage defamation victims is not acceptable.

But what is Ed's motivation?....  

Evidence suggests that he simply wants to torment me because I’ve exposed his appalling business practices in videos like this one: EXPOSED: RipOffReport.com & Why It Appears Page 1 of Google

FAQs / What Are The Benefits To The Community?


Finally, Ed Magedson Will Face a Jury! No Section §230c Immunity this Time

This lawsuit against Ed Magedson and RipOffReport.com is unique because Ed Magedson has personally libeled me and my company Common Decency, Inc and others. (This is assuming we raise enough money to file a counterclaim)

Ed Magedson has also allegedly hired, or otherwise engaged a man named Darren M Meade who, by his own admission in a deposition last year, is a paid Internet reputation-hit-man. Because Darren M Meade has been acting as an agent provocateur for Ed Magedson, the latter cannot claim to be merely a conduit and thus, is not immune to liability under §230(C) of the Communications Decency Act.

Ed Magedson has engaged Darren Meade as his agent and spokesman. Consequently both he and his company Xcentric Ventures, LLC are liable for every word printed by Darren Meade on RipOffReport.com.

(3) How Will the Money be Used?

NOTE: Donations WILL NOT be used for director salaries!

As Common Decency, Inc. founder, I have independent income and provision (although it has been severely reduced due to the Ripoffreport.com lies).

All donations/subscription will be consolidated into the civil litigation effort against Ed Magedson and his company Xcentric Ventures DBA RipOffReport.com and his co-defendants.

(4) What will Happen to the Money if We Win the Lawsuit?

On the assumption that we prevail and damages are recovered from Ed Magedson and/or his company Xcentric Ventures, LLC, then every dollar donated to the legal fighting fund will be matched dollar for dollar from the proceeds of the damages recovered by way of a donation to the soon-to-be established “Common Decency Foundation”. This foundation will help fight other battles in the future where unscrupulous website operators, like Magedson, take advantage of loopholes in the law to conduct what is tantamount to legalized extortion.

(5) But How Does this End the Anguish Caused by RipOffReport.com ?

Part of its legal battle will involve a financial colonoscopy of Ed Magedson and his company Xcentric Ventures, LLC.. For example, if his assets are in his mother’s name or a trust, then we will pursue an asset that is worth much more to this planet than hidden money; and that is the actual RipOffReport.com domain. As you can see in the following link, he made a strategic error in registering that domain to the same company that offends and injures so many good people. Ownership of the RipOffReport.com domain is our target and our promise to the world is that we will pursue that asset with all the gusto we can garner.

Domain Ownership Record for Ripoffreport.com.

But we need your help! Please join the “Common Decency Army” and help in the following ways:

  • Financially through donations to this legal fighting fund
  • By flooding the social networks with news of this battle
  • By tweeting, liking and subscribing to our social networking community.
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Like us on Facebook

In order to prevail in taking ownership of this domain, we need to be awarded a judgment for financial damages in excess of what Ed Magedson can pay. At that point, we will be able to file a motion with the court in an attempt to levy the domain ownership as part payment of his damages debt.

My promise to the world is this-- if we prevail in court, and if we are successful in levying the domain ownership, the website will be shut down and the only thing that will be visible will be an illustration depicting Ed Magedson bound and gagged. Furthermore, we promise, if possible, to open the log files for every Ripoff Report ever made to reveal the identities of the not-so-anonymous authors of the complaints.

These promises are not just empty words; as CEO of Common Decency, Inc., I will bind the company, and myself as plaintiffs in this case, to the rest of the world with a covenant binding us to these conditions. If you give to this cause, when you click “confirm”, you will be effectively executing the contract with me so that these promises are binding.

(6) But Doesn’t RipOffReport.com Expose Some Real Scammers?

Yes it does, but is the cost of this benefit too high?

It should be said that there are presumably tens of thousands of genuine scammers who are exposed through the RipOffReport.com website. However, the adage  “you can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs” does not hold water when the cook is Ed Magedson.

Ed Magedson has lost all claims to social heroism because he chooses a “we do not remove complaints” policy, even when unimpeachable evidence is available to vindicate the falsely accused victims of his website. Free speech is not free! It always costs someone. If it costs a bad guys, then great; but if it hurts the innocent then it is bad for people.

NOTE RE MEDIA: Journalists in the past have pumped up Ed Magedson's narcissistic supply by embracing him as a media darling and social champion, whereas, he is in our eyes an emotional terrorist. The Common Decency Army must educate journalists that their lifting up of Ripoffreport's Ed Magedson as a hero is hurting hundreds of thousands of innocent people.

 Contact me at donate [at] CommonDecencyInc.org

+1-408-916-5977 USA
+44 (0) 20 3286 3377 United Kingdom
+358 9 2316 9888 Europe
+61 (0) 73040 2223 Australia
"mrrexx777" Skype

Common Decency, Inc.
1562 First Ave # 205-1716
New York, NY 10028-4004
